Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag is a 27-year-old divorced woman who lives with her son in a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her 4-year-old son, Shine-Erdene, goes to a local kindergarten school. She has been operating a retail clothes business for two years. She has already built a strong customer base and supplier base. She imports clothes from Erlian, China. During her travels, she leaves her son with her parents. 

Mrs. Tungalag is building a small, energy-efficient house for herself and her son. She needs an additional investment of 500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials and windows. She is a hardworking and strong woman who says, "My son and I will live happily in our new warm house during the winters."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and windows for her house.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding-shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her welding-shop business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. Mary Ann earns additional income from a general store and raising chickens.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her welding shop.

loans.name: Marybel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marybel works hard to support her family.

She has a ambulant vending dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Marybel is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Marybel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es: La señora es comerciante desde hace 6 años del mercado de Chinandega, su actividad es venta de pescado fresco y seco, camarón, conchas etc. Es una señora que se esfuerza por salir adelante vende de lunes a sábado desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, de ella dependen dos hijos que están estudiando la  secundaria, poco a poco ha mejorado su calidad de vida pero ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda y  darles una mejor condición a toda su familia con mucho esfuerzo, se siente bastante agradecida con los financiamientos que le hemos brindado ya que ella siente que su negocio ha venido incrementando y  sus ganancias .
texts.en: This woman has been a merchant for 6 years in the Chinandega market. Her activity is selling fresh and dried fish, shrimp, oysters, etc. She is a woman who works hard to get ahead Monday through Saturday from five in the morning until four in the afternoon. Her two children depend on her; they are in secondary school. Little by little, she has improved her quality of life, but she dreams of finishing construction on her house and giving her whole family a better quality of life with a lot of hard work. She is very grateful for the loans that we have offered her because hse feels that her business has grown and so have her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Tuvshin

texts.en:
Tuvshin, who is 47 years old, lives with his wife and his son in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife Delhiitsetseg, age of 47, works as saleswoman at local bookstore. His son works at a gas station as assistant worker. 

Tuvshin has been producing ice-cream out of organic milk from cattle since 2003. He is famous in the area and his business is stable. He is planning to purchase another ice-cream machine for his business. He is now requesting 600'000 MNT to purchase the ice-cream machine for his organic ice-cream production business. He is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy an ice-cream machine for his organic ice-cream production business.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Amor de Mujeres esta conformado por 16 integrantes, casados, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son personas trabajadoras, responsables, humilde, con ganas de superación personal para salir adelante con sus hijos. Ellos son originarios del departamento del Sauce, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche.  Meylin es la coordinadora del banco comunal Amor de Mujeres ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de leche y cuajada en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de leche. El banco comunal Amor de Mujeres agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Mujeres" is composed of sixteen members, all married. In total, the members have 20 children. They are hardworking, responsible and humble women, with a strong will to thrive and get ahead in life with their children. They come from the Sauce region, located in the north of the country. The region is known for its milk production.

Meylin is the coordinator of this communal bank. She sells milk and cottage cheese, both at home and as a street vendor. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business with milk. The communal bank "Amor de Mujeres" appreciates the help provided by Kiva lenders, because thanks to them, people with less economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua have access to decent sources of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock her business.

loans.name: Ninoska Maricielo

texts.es: Ninoska tiene 20 años. Ella estudia la carrera de Terapia Física y  Rehabilitación en una Universidad local, sus estudios duran 05 años y le falta 03 años para graduarse, cuando culmine su carrera  le gustaría trabajar  en un hospital o clínica de prestigio para poder ayudar a muchas personas, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo usara para pagar la pensión de un semestre, considera que su préstamo es de mucha ayuda para continuar con sus estudios, ya que la parte económica muchas veces es un obstáculo para muchos jóvenes que quieren estudiar. Ninoska esta agradecida a los inversionistas de Kiva por apoyarla en sus estudios.
texts.en: Ninoska is 20 years old. She studies physical therapy and rehabilitation at a local university. Her major lasts for five years and she has three more years to go until graduation. When she finishes her studies she would like to work in a prestigious hospital or clinic to be able to help a lot of people. The loan she has asked for will be used to pay for a semster's tuition. She considers the loan to be a big help for continuing her studies, since the financial part is aften a big obstacle for a lot of young people who want to study. Ninoska is grateful to the Kiva investors for helping her with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semseter's tuition.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. Este es el grupo  “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” con 08 integrantes, que pasan a su 5to ciclo, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Julia es viuda y tiene 03 hijos independientes. A sus 58 años Julia ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y a ayudar a sus hijos en su educación. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y chupetes en las afueras de un colegio, sus mayores clientes son  alumnos de dicho colegio. Seguir mejorando su vivienda es su mayor deseo. Con el crédito que solicito comprará una cocina y frutas para la preparación de chupetes.  El grupo “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” está agradecido y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Julia se encuentra de pie es la cuarta del lado izquierdo tiene  polo  color negro y pantalón azul.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru. This is the “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” [Unity Makes Strength]  group, with 8 members. They are in their 5th cycle, and the large majority of them are residents of the area. Julia is a widow and has 3 grown children. At 58 years old, Julia has been able to acheive some of her dreams, such as improving her home and helping her children get an education. Right now she sells gelatin and lollipops outside of a high school. Most of her customers come from the high school. To keep improving her home is her biggest wish. With the loan she asked for, she will buy a stove and some fruit to make her lollipops. The “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” group is grateful and committed to continuing to work well with Programa- Prosperidad. Julia is standing and is the fourth one from the left. She has on a black shirt on and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy a stove and some fruit.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 36 años es un hombre sencillo. Vive en compañía de su esposa Alicia, con quién tiene 2 hijas: Lisbeth y Noemí, a las que cuida en la casa que le heredó su padre hace 15 años. Como hijo de campo, que nació y compartió su vida entre las personas que viven de la crianza de animales y producción de la tierra. Él también comparte por más de 10 años la siembra de diversos productos agrícolas, en principal maíz; pues le rinde buenas ganancias. Pero la principal actividad económica de Alberto, se centra en la crianza de animales como vacas y cerdos en cantidad, comenta que por la cantidad de animales que posee los lleva a criar en las alturas de los cerros, donde puede alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales. Después de alimentarlos y cuando se encuentren maduros los comercializa en la ciudad, donde vende como carne. Pero hay días en los obtiene compradores en el mismo lugar de crianza, “esos son días en los que obtengo más ganancias, pues vendo a un mayor precio”, afirma. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, agradece al poyo recibido en este corto tiempo, pues le ayudó a obtener el capital necesario para emprender su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Alberto, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias cabezas de cerdos para mejorar la producción de su ganado.
texts.en:
Alberto is 36 years old and a down to earth man. He lives with his wife Alicia, with whom he has 2 daughters: Lisbeth and Noemí. He takes care of them in the house he inherited from his father 15 years ago. 

A child of the countryside, he was born and bred among people who live by rearing animals and cultivating the land. For more than 10 years he has planted various agricultural products, mostly corn; it brings him good profits. But Alberto's main economic activity is the rearing of animals like cows and pigs in large quantities. He says that as he has so many animals he breeds them high up in the hills, where he can feed them on natural pastures.

After feeding them, and when they have become mature, he takes them to market in the city, where he sells them as meat. But sometimes he finds buyers in the same place that he breeds the animals. "These are the days that I make the most profits, as I sell at a higher price", he declares. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support received in this short time, as it has helped him raise the capital necessary to undertake his business. For this reason he promises to be punctual in the payment of his instalments. 

Alberto will invest the money in the purchase of some pigs to improve the output of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy some pigs

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mechill works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Mechill is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Mechill has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 60 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Lucio, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que criaron con mucho amor; ahora ellos viven con su nieta en una casa alquilada.   
Ya no tiene hijos a quienes cuidar, todo ellos son grandes y maduros; se siente orgullosa. Pero tiene que trabajar junto a su esposo para poder mantenerse y no brindar preocupaciones además de criar a su nieta. El trabajo al que se dedica es la siembra de maíz, papa y alfalfa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida constantemente, ya en la cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes fijos. Asimismo su esposo recibe una pensión por la jubilación de su trabajo, con el tiempo ahorro dinero para comprar un auto, ahora trabaja como taxista en el trasporte público entre dos ciudades cercanas, saco todo los permisos ahora solo le falta uno para poder trabajar con tranquilidad, obtiene buenas ganancias de su trabajo, porque es su propio auto y así obtiene mejores ingresos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.Reyna, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de Abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 60 years old, and she is a wise woman.  She lives with Lucio, her husband of 17 years. They have seven children who they raised with great love, and they now live with their granddaughter in a rented house.

Reyna doesn't look after any of her children now, because they have all grown up, and this makes her feel proud. But she and her husband still have to work  to support themselves and raise their granddaughter without any other worries. She makes a living growing corn, potatoes and alfalfa on her own land, which she always takes good care of. During harvest time, she sells her produce in the wholesale market in the city, where she has regular customers. 

In addition to this, her husband receives a pension from the job he did before he retired. Over time, he saved up to buy a car, and now works as a public transport taxi driver between two nearby cities. He has obtained all the necessary licenses and he only needs one more in order to work with peace of mind. The job pays well because he uses his own car, which means he makes more profit. 

Reyna belongs to the "San Lorenzo" support group, and this is their thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is hoping for a small loan which will allow her to achieve her goals. She promises to meet her loan repayments, just as she did with the last loan she received. She enjoys being part of the association because all its members are responsible and supportive. Reyna will use the money she has requested to buy organic compost to put on her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Petisi

texts.en:
Petisi is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She needs a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to extend her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Petisi will use the profits from her sales to save for her kids' education.

loans.use: to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to extend her plantation (fertilizers, bush knife, wheelbarrow, shovels...)

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 36 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Merly has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and chickens. She aspires to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en: Vasati is 42 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Vasati needs a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Vasati will use the profits from her sales to save in account for a family faalavelave (a traditional Samoan celebration normally associated with funerals or weddings).

loans.use: to purchase more farming tools and chemicals (wheelbarrow, gloves, bush knives...)

loans.name: Tolusefulutasi

texts.en: Tolusefulutasi is a 43-year-old married woman with 9 children. She would like to start growing cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Tolusefulutasi has requested a loan to purchase seeds and farming tools to start her business. This is her first year as a member of SPBD. Tolusefulutasi will spend her profits to save for her kids' education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farming tools (fertilizers, gloves, bush knives...)

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 35 year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Huong requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder and shampoos, to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder and shampoos, to stock her store

loans.name: Metria

texts.en:
Metria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from selling flowers.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Metria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 56, is married and has five sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by running a general store in front of their house. They started this business twelve years ago.  They sell milk, soft drinks, confectionery and household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular snack foods and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular snack foods and household items, to stock her store.

loans.name: Gom

texts.en: Gom is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by selling food to the people in their community. Gom is requesting a loan to buy good quality food ingredients for her food stall and soft drinks to sell. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality food ingredients for her food stall and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, a 37-year old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with one daughter. Her husband supports his family by working in a nearby company. Thuy runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thuy requests a loan to purchase more products such as stationery, candies, snack foods, and soft drinks to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as stationery, candies, snack foods, and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell such as snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Nilda has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling gasoline. Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell such as snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jestas

texts.en:
Jestas is a 54-year-old married man with eight children aged between nine months and 20 years. He describes himself as a hard working and jovial man. For two years he has been operating a grocery store selling household products such as flour, sugar, tea, bread, soda, water and cooking oil. His business is located in a market place and his primary customers are local residents from the surrounding area. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds to improve the store. 

Jestas will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more products to sell. His business goal is to expand his store within 5 years and he hopes that in the future, he will be able to pay for his children's education. In addition, Jestas runs other businesses, such as farming, photography, tailoring and shoe sales, which increase his income and enable him to support his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, where he previously received a loan of 20,000 KES that he managed to pay off successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rona works hard to support her family.

She has a sells bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas. Rona is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 66 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who runs a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Rosa has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been operating for 40 years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice.

Rosalina has been in this business for 9 years and earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 21-year-old married woman. She has a child. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells groceries such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, maize flour, and cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a local area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy groceries to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Matuli

texts.en: Matuli is a 68-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small farm and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Matuli has requested a loan to buy young piglets, barbed wire for the fence, pig food, nails and timber. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Matuli hopes to expand her farm by adding more pigs.

loans.use: to buy young piglets, barbed wire, and nails.

loans.name: Ablawa Philomène's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 59ans, Philomène la responsable est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont trois sont encore scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 30ans et 17ans. Philomène vend des sacs de maïs depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la forte de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Philomène se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two women who have taken a joint loan. Philomene, the leader, is 59 years old, married, and the mother of five children, three of whom have been educated. The oldest is 30 and the youngest is 17.  Philomene has been selling sacks of corn for several years and gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin.   With the goal of increasing her buying power and to satisfy the large demand of her customers, she has requested and received a micro-loan through Finadev in order to maximize her profits and to contribute to the education of her children. Philomene is to the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of corn.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is a 51-year old married woman. She has three sons and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a driver for hire. Nga supports her family by running a food stall that sells soy-bean milk to the people in the local community. She would like a loan to buy a greater quantity of soy-beans for making milk to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income so that she can improve her family's condition and save in order to face difficulties in the future.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of soy-beans for making milk.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is a 57-year old widowed woman. She has two sons and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns a living working as a tailor. She is requesting a loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, a 45-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband earns a living working as a machinist. Hong runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to the local community. 

She requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos to stock her store.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet, a 57-year-old divorced woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Tuyet runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community. 

She requests a loan to purchase more products such as candies, snack foods, and instant noodles to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as candies, snack foods, and instant noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Norma has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport. Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her meat-vending business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through the past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Puaaelo

texts.en:
Puaaelo is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community, which she has been doing for one year. 

Puaaelo is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy flour, sugar, two frying pans, cooking oil, and an oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Puaaelo will pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, frying pans, cooking oil, and a new oven.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. 

Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, and an oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Elisapeta will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. He describes himself as a determined man. 

Simion operates a bicycle repair business where he provides services on bicycle repair. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a viable shopping centre area and his primary customers are bicycle owners from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of bicycle spare parts. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy bicycle spare parts. 

Simion's business goal is to expand his business to offering motorcycles repair services within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have expanded his business.

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 43 years old and has two children.  He is a resident of Balintawak, Aurora. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for 21 years.  He raises corn and earns 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Juanito joined GDMPC.  He is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which he will uses to purchase fertilizers. In the future, Juanito wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is 22  years old and single. She has a small billiard table business, which she has been doing for two years. 

Orepa joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a new pool table and new cue tips. She will use her profits to maintain the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new pool table and cue tips.

loans.name: Akuvi Aline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux membres en caution solidaire. Akuvi Aline la responsable est âgée de 39ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et de benjamin ont respectivement 21ans et 04ans. Elle prépare et vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le profit dégagé par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison. Akuvi Aline se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two women with a joint loan.  Akuvi Aline, the leader, is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children who attend school.  The oldest is 21 and the youngest is four years old.  She has been preparing and selling food from her home for several years and gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin.  With the goal of increasing her working capital and to meet the demand of her customers, she has requested and received a loan through Finadev.  The profits resulting from this loan will allow her to contribute to her children's schooling and to help her husband finish construction on their house.  Akuvi Aline is to the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice, one sack of wheat flour, two sacks of charcoal, two baskets of tomatoes, and one basket of peppers.

loans.name: Benoite's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 28ans, Benoite la responsable est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 9mois. Gérante d'un bar-restaurant depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans les dépôts SOBEBRA de la place en boissons et dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer aux charges de la famille. Benoite se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group consists of two members with joint liability. Benoite, age 28, is the group leader. She is on the left in the photo. She is a married mother of a 9-month-old child. Benoite has been running a bar-restaurant for a few years. She buys her stock of beverages at the local SOBEBRA depots, and at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her working capital and meet the needs of a growing customer base, she obtained a loan from Finadev. This credit will allow her to maximize her profits and to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of beverages and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.es: Julián de 36 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, área Metropolitana de la ciudad, lugar donde se dedica al comercio de productos variados, los cuales distribuye a crédito entre sus clientes, desde hace 19 años, desde que salió del colegió y sintió la necesidad de generar ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades. En su negocio empezó a vender pocas cosas, pero gradualmente ha agregado, bolsos, calzado, artículos para el hogar, fantasía, y últimamente vende yogurt que preparan de manera artesanal y a la gente le gusta mucho porque es muy natural. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito en su totalidad y por eso su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para aumentar el numero de clientes, porque debe esperar a recoger su dinero, producto de sus cuentas por cobrar para poder surtirlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa para damas, caballeros, calzado femenino especialmente, pues se prepara para responder a los pedidos de su clientela en esta navidad, época en la cual las familias esperan estas fiestas para lucir elegantes y darle la bienvenida al año nuevo.
texts.en:
Julián is thirty-six years old and lives in the municipality of Soledad, a metropolitan area of the city where he makes a living in selling various products, which he distributes between his clients on credit.  He has been doing this for nineteen years, ever since he left high school and he felt the necessity to generate an imcome in order to satisfy his needs.

In his business, he began by selling a few things, but he has gradually added other items, like bags, footwear, household items, accessories, and lately, he also sells handmade yogurt, which the people love because it's very natural.  

Because sales to customers are made entirely on credit, his working capital is insufficient to grow his customer base since he must wait to collect the money from accounts receivable before he can stock up his business.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, and it is his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy clothing for women and men, especially women's footwear.  He will prepare to respond to the requests of his customers for Christmas, a season in which families wait for the festivities to look elegant and to welcome in the new year.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and men, especially women's footwear.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Like so many military wives, Melanie was forced to constantly relocate as duty called for her husband. Dealing with the constant stress of having her husband deployed, while also trying to make new friends and conform to local customs, Melanie found peace and sanctuary in yoga. She discovered a deeper respect for yoga’s positive impact on her life and dedicated herself to becoming a practitioner. 

After she received her yoga certification, Melanie and her husband were once again relocated to Southern California. In a community very well versed with many types of yoga, she was first exposed to AntiGravity. This unique style allows anybody to engage in low-impact, zero-compression inversion, which allows anybody to practice it. Being surrounded by disabled veterans, as well as military mothers and the elderly, Melanie hopes to offer special yoga classes to meet these individuals’ unique needs.

With her husband being gone three weeks a month, Melanie is daily overcoming the struggles of starting a business while raising her baby. Melanie’s $10,000 Kiva loan will allow her to finish remodeling her studio and make the final equipment purchases to open her business.   

A strong believer in the healing powers of yoga, Melanie envisions her studio as a place of healing, where troops have the ability to relieve both physical and mental pains in a comfortable and warm environment.

loans.use: to remodel her studio and purchase equipment.

loans.name: Lamepa

texts.en:
Lamepa is 40 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Lamepa has requested a loan to buy taro, cooking oil, a deep pot, and a brand new oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Lamepa hopes to buy some new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy taro, cooking oil, a deep pot, salt, and a new oven.

loans.name: Aristedes

texts.en:
Aristedes is a 63-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, and a mother of nine grown up children. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years now.

Aristedes is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow a healthy pigs.

Aristedes hopes to expand her business in the future, and save money for reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 35-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small farm and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy some young piglets, barbed wire for the fence, pig food, and a wheelbarrow. She just joined SPBD this year. 

With her profits, Maria hopes to build a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy young piglets, barbed wire, pig food, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 35-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself as hardworking. 

He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents and businesspeople. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as shortage of clothes to sell to customers to meet their needs. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. 

His business goal is to open a another similar retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 43, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a foreman, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emelita operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like flat irons, washing machines, DVD players, rice cookers, standing fans and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emelita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education and hopes to have her own car through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like flat irons, washing machines, DVD players, rice cookers, standing fans and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as focused and business-oriented. 

He operates a grocery stall where he sells potatoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a viable business market  and his primary customers are local residents and retail businesspeople. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy potatoes to sell. 

His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family (parents). This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bags of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 42 years old and married. She has four children. 

She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Aiga has requested a loan to buy a deep pot, baking soda, cooking oil and sugar. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aiga will save up for her children's college fees.

loans.use: to buy a deep pot, baking soda, cooking oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 21 years to 30 years. She describes herself as a faithful and caring woman. 

She operates a grocery stall where she sells cereals and vegetables such as tomatoes, maize, beans, black beans, peas, etc. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

She says her biggest business challenge is insecurity within the area and stiff competition. 

She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her six family members for household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took a loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a trader from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She earns a living by buying and selling various farm products to the market.

Daniela has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Daniela gives her best to support her husband in meeting the needs of the  family especially for the schooling of her children.

Daniela is asking for a loan to buy more agricultural products like bananas, root crops and fruits. With this, she will be able to enhance her income by selling more products to the market.

In the future, Daniela hopes to improve her business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more agricultural products like bananas, root crops and fruits.

loans.name: Audra

texts.en:
Audra is 52 years old and married. She has four children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of general items. She has been doing this for two years. Audra needs a loan to buy a sack of onions, a box of soap, cartons of cigarettes and a new cash register. 

She hopes to use her profits to secure her children's education in the future by saving up. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of onions, a box of soap, cartons of cigarettes and a new cash register.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana previously requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she used to buy gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Susana is requesting another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her family’s daily needs.

Susana dreams of being able to give her children a good education and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, a 38-year-old widowed mother of two children aged 14 and 11 years, has been operating a beauty salon in Narok for six years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

Leah has requested her second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD in order to purchase more salon equipment. The anticipated new profits will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own a residential plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment.

loans.name: Dairon Ezequiel

texts.es:
Dairon Ezequiel  tiene 26 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Dairon Ezequiel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz desde hace 8 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza y pagar a los jornaleros. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca y sembrar cacao. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Dairon Ezequiel is 26 years old, married with one son, and lives with his wife and son in the city of Ventanas in los Ríos province.  He is a member of the JERUSALEN communal bank located in the El Caimito area, in Puerto Peniche parrish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this group make a living in short cycle agricultural work, growing corn, rice, and gandul beans.

Dairon Ezequiel has made a living by growing corn and rice for eight years.  He asks for the loan to buy seed, insecticide, urea, liquid weed killer, and to pay the laborers.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizer for his crops.  

He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas city in the los Ríos province.  The challenges he faces are the plagues and poor weather.  His dream is to buy a farm and grow cocoa.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.  

He is very grateful for the help from the previous loan because he was able to buy what was necessary for his crops and they improved the income for his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, urea, liquid weed killer, and to pay the laborers.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria  tiene 26 años de edad es casada tiene una hija y un hijo, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Ana Maria  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
"Esta muy agradecida por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Ana Maria is twenty-six years old, is married, and has a daughter and son.  She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the Jerusalen communal bank, which is located in the El Caimito precint of the Puerto Pechichi parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank devotes itself to the agricultural work of growing short-cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  

Ana Maria makes a living growing corn and rice.  She is asking for a loan to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weed-killer, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy all the types of fertilizers she needs for her crops.

She does all of her buying and selling in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  The challenges that she is faced with are the plagues and the bad climate.

Her dream is to buy a farm.  In her free time, she likes to play soccer.  She is very thankful for the help of her previous loan; she was able to buy what was necessary for her crops and increased the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weed-killer, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Awavi

texts.fr: Agée de 32ans, Awavi est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Les enfants ont respectivement 10ans et 04ans. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes depuis deux ans puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du bénin. Dans le but de d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de rentabiliser son activité et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle envisage acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Awavi, age 32, is a married mother of two children aged 4 and 10 who both go to school. She has been selling cosmetic products and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for two years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her working capital and meet the needs of her customers, she turned to the Finadev microfinance institution to help make her activity profitable and to support her children’s education. For the future, she plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 8 pagnes, 1 carton of pomades, and 1 carton of perfume.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса использовала предыдущий кредит на закупку семян и обустройство своей первой теплицы. Раньше она работала продавцем, зарплаты была маленькой, поэтому Лариса решила начать свое дело и работать на себя. Сейчас вырос ее сын и хочет помогать маме. Лариса хочет взять кредит для постройки еще одной теплицы. В результате они смогут выращивать в два раза больше овощей и увеиличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Larisa used her preceding loan to buy seeds and to construct her first greenhouse. Previously, she worked as a salesperson and her salary was small, so Larisa decided to start her own business and work for herself. Now her son has grown and he wants to help his mother. 

Larisa wants to take a loan to build one more greenhouse. As a result, they will be able to grow twice as many vegetables and to increase the family income.

loans.use: to build one more greenhouse

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Вера расширила ассортимент купальников, увеличила торговый оборот и получила дополнительную прибыль. Теперь вместе с мужем они начали строительство своего дома. Строят медленно, но сами.

В этот раз Вера просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки сезонного товара. Она планирует привлечь больше клиентов и получить еще больше прибыли, чтобы ускорить строительство дома.
texts.en:
Thanks to her preceding loan, Vera expanded her range of swimwear, increased trade and earned extra income. Now, she and her husband started building their home. They are building slowly, by themselves.

This time, Vera is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal goods. She plans to attract more customers and to get even more money in order to speed up the home construction.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Сильвия увеличила ассортимент летнего товара. На полученную прибыль начала делать ремонт в доме. В этот раз Сильвия просит предоставить кредит для закупки зимнего товара - женских свитеров и кофт. 

Недавно Сильвия уезжала на две недели из города. На ее месте торговала подруга. Так как для подруги все было новое, то после возвращения Сильвии пришлось наводить порядок на торговой точке. Тем не меенее, для Сильвии это был отдых от работы.
texts.en:
Thanks to her preceding loan, Silviya expanded her assortment of summer clothing. With the profits realized, she began to make repairs on her home. 

This time, Silviya is asking for a loan to purchase winter goods: women's sweaters and jackets.  

Silviya recently left for two weeks out of town. In her place, a friend was selling. Since it was all new for her friend, Silviya had to restore order at her market stall after her return. However, for Siliviya it had been a good rest from work.

loans.use: to buy winter goods

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: В этот раз Наталья просит предоставить ей небольшой кредит для закупки зимних спортивных курток. Увеличилась закупочная цена и нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы не уменьшать объем закупки. Кредит позволит Натальше не использовать средства, которые она отложила для ремонта дома, и продолжить ремонт.
texts.en:
This time Natalya is asking us to give her a small loan for the purchase of winter sports jackets. The purchase price was increased and additional funds are needed so as not to reduce the volume of the purchase. 

The loan will enable Natalshe (friendly form of her name) not to use money that she put into home renovation and to continue the repairs.

loans.use: to buy winter jackets

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентина торгует женским нижним бельем на рынке. Киоск собственный. Опыт работы - 17 лет. Просит предоставить кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. Валентина - трудолюбивая и ответственная. Несмотря на сезонные спады торговли и повышение закупочных цен, Валентина намерена идти только вперед и развивать свой бизнес дальше.
texts.en:
Valentina sells ladies' undergarments at the market. She has her own kiosk and 17 years of experience. 

She is asking for a loan to increase her assortment of goods. Valentina is hardworking and responsible. Despite the seasonal decline of trade and the increase in the purchase price, Valentina intends only to go forward and to further develop her business.

loans.use: to expand the variety of her goods

loans.name: Daisy Esmeralda

texts.es: Daisy tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella lleva 5 años de generar sus propios ingresos, estableció un negocio de venta de pollo frito, chuleta frita con tajadas de banano. Es un tipo de comida rápida que tiene gran demanda. Daisy quiere comprar una estufa industrial para utilizarla en la elaboración de comida y mantener siempre los insumos principales como es la carne de pollo y chuletas de cerdo y res, por lo tanto ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras,  el cual le ayudara a cocinar mas rápido las comidas y a comprar de contado y en cantidades mayores de carnes. Tiene como meta seguir trabajando con préstamos para obtener ganancias y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daisy, age 44, is single and has two children.  She lives with them in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

She has been generating her own income for five years.  She set up a business selling fried chicken and fried pork chops with fried plantain slices.  This type of fast food is in great demand.

Daisy wants to buy an industrial stove to use when making the food.  She wants to always have the main ingredients like chicken, pork chops, and beef.  Therefore, she has decided to request a loan for 10,000 lempiras.  The loan will help her cook the food more quickly, and she will be able to buy greater quantities of meat for cash.  

Her goal is to continue working with loans in order to get income and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken and meat to make food and to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es: Jose, tiene 38 años, casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. El tiene 7 años de dedicarse a prestar servicio de transporte de personas en una moto taxi, dentro del área urbana de la ciudad. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia.  Jose esta solicitando un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento general y reparación del motor de su moto taxi. Con esta inversión quiere mejorar el servicio y comodidad a sus clientes, para obtener ingresos. Este es el segundo préstamo que obtiene con ODEF y ha demostrado responsabilidad. Tiene como meta mantener siempre el negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio y poder darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 38, is married and has three children.  He lives in the Morazan municipality in Yoro.  He has been providing transportation services for people in his ‘moto taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle] for seven years.  He provides transportation within the urban area of the city.  This business is his source of income to support his family.

Jose is requesting a loan for 11,000 lempiras to provide general maintenance to his moto taxi and to repair the motor.  With this investment he wants to improve service and customer comfort in order to get income.  This is the second loan that he has had with ODEF, and he has demonstrated responsibility.

His goal is to always keep his business, to continue supporting his children’s education, and to be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to provide general maintenance to his moto taxi and to repair the motor.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
This is Argie, who previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Argie is requesting another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items that are displayed in the store, the greater potential there is for better profits, profits that will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Argie hopes her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Trinidad, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a retailing business for almost a year now. She sells pants, shirts, slippers and other ready-to-wear and clothing materials. This is the source of her income.
 
Geraldine is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like pants, jeans, slippers, shirts and others. With this, she will be able to sell more products to her customers.

In the future, Geraldine wants to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like pants, jeans, slippers, shirts and others.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and a mother of four dependents. She is 48 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. 

Emma is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She delivers vegetables like leafy vegetables and squash to the local market. She has been doing this business for six years. She earns PHP 10,000 each month in this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Emma is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Emma hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en:
Maresa is a married woman with three children. Maresa is 32 years old, residing at Solinog, Calamba. 

Maresa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living and she has been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

This year, Maresa joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  

In the future, Maresa wants to build a house and to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four; two of them are school-going. 

She is efficiently performing a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. They have been doing it together for the past ten years. Now they have eight buffaloes and two cows. (The man shown in the photo is Zareena’s husband.)

Every morning she milks her cows and buffaloes and prepares liters of milk that her husband takes to the market to sell along with butter, cheese and ghee that Zareena makes from the milk. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. They make enough to bear the expenses of the family members.
 
She needs to expand her business to fulfill the demands of her children, including food, clothing and education. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers, which will ultimately help in bringing more cash to her home. She desires to use the part of the revenue on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: Ms Majeedan is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been in business making gloves for ten years. Her husband works in agriculture, and her two sons are employed in a power loom factory. However, due to rolling blackout (load shedding) crises in Pakistan, they can’t earn enough to support the family circle. This compelled her to contribute to the family income by using her sewing skills. She not only supplies gloves in her neighborhood, but also has become a permanent supplier to retailers in the local market. Majeedan also stitches clothes as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to cope with her family's needs effectively. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. she is satisfied with the support she receives. Since the winter season is approaching, she has applied for a loan of 18000 PKR to buy more bundles of good quality wool in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet her orders on time, which will ultimately help her to bring more cash home. She wants to spend part of the profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality wool in various colors to make gloves to sell.

loans.name: Noemie Jean

texts.en: Noemie Jean is from Sapang Dalaga. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. To make a living, Noemie Jean owns and operates a business making roofing materials made of nipa palm. Noemie Jean has been engaged in this business for five years, and she earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2012, Noemie Jean joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy nipa palm for weaving into roofing materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as sugar, margarine, flour and cheese, for use in making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en: Mercidita, from San Miguel, Boholis, is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is engaged in the food vending business. She prepares home-cooked snack food and sells it to her neighbors. Mercidita is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, such as flour, margarine, sugar and cooking oil. In this way, she will be able to cook more and sell more, thus increasing her income and profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as flour, margarine, sugar and cooking oil, for her business of making and selling snacks.

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en: Anesia is 38 years old, married, and has 1 child. She is from Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Anesia grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for 4 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. Anesia is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Anesia joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the vegetable garden

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, 28, considers herself to be a very charismatic, honest and unassuming person who very much likes to work. She lives with her children and husband in Samburu, which is located in Kenya's Coast Province. Mwanaidi works alone, buying and selling clothes such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, tops, etc. She has worked in this business for two years and does very well thanks to her charisma and her good products.  The profits she gets from this business are used for household expenses and to cover her children's needs. 

Mwanaidi has asked Yehu for a loan to buy bales of clothes such as pants, t-shirts, blouses, sweaters and underwear in order to have greater variety in her store. Mwanaidi dreams of improving her children's quality of life by giving them good schooling.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes such as pants, t-shirts, blouses, sweaters and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Bong

texts.en: Bong is requesting a new loan to buy quality food to provide to her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality food to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
With this new loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) that he is requesting from Yehu, Michael wants to grow his business by restocking it with more products. He plans to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, flour, detergent, eggs, shortening, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines and other products. 

Michael's goal is to continue to be in business and provide for his family. He is grateful for the previous loan, which he says had a positive impact on his business. This new loan will enable him to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, flour, detergent, eggs, shortening, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines and other products.

loans.name: Phancy

texts.en:
Phancy operates a school in a peri-urban area of Siaya. Her students come from the school's nearby environs. She describes herself to be a business-oriented woman and she takes pride in providing an education to local students. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be delayed payments from the students' parents and guardians. Her business goal is to expand her school compound within five years. 

Phancy is married and lives with her family.

This is Phancy's third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was in the amount of Kes 150,000 and was used to boost her school business. She is grateful to SMEP DTM for the financial assistance.

She is presently requesting a loan in the amount of Kes 41,500 loan in order to purchase a water tank for her household.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Celia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continua dedicándose  a la venta alimentos y bebidas en su restaurante, negocio  con el cual ha podido consolidar su actividad
Celia en esta como en anteriores oportunidades  está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carne, arroz, menestras verduras etc. para la elaboración de sus alimentos, y  por todo ello, Celia  está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su u actividad, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the communal bank “Los Diamantes” from the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues to make a living through food and drink sales in her restaurant, a business with which she has been able to consolidate her activity.

Celia on this as on previous occasions is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as meat, rice, beans, vegetables, etc., for the preparations of her food. For all of this, Celia is very thankful to Kiva for the support that it provides her and for helping her in maintaining her activity, which represents the principal economic income and means of support of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the production of her restaurant.

loans.name: Dougouyiriwaton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Dougouyiriwaton 1  ont  en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de NIKANKAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, des articles divers et la préparation vente de beignet. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame,  Sitan (1ère personne gauche de la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 kg de petit mil auprès des producteurs dans son village, puisse quelle fait beignets de très bonne qualité. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Sitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 8.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en: All married and living in traditional extended families, the seven women of Dougouyiriwaton 1 Group have an average age of 46 and six children.  They all live in the village of Nikankan in Segou, the 4th largest administrative region in Mali.  They know each other via neighborhood ties, marriage, and kinship.  They buy and sell cereals and various goods as well as make and sell doughnuts.  In order to enhance their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.  Ms. Sitan (first person, from left to right, in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 50 kg of millet from the farmers in her village.  Then she will make very high-quality doughnuts that she sells for cash to a clientele of women and men. With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 8,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Muhabbathon

texts.ru: Мухаббатхон, женщина  в возрасте 19 лет, проживающая в сельской местности.   Мухаббатхон работает в детском саду, воспитательницей.   В свободное от работы время   по выходным она занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды.    Мухаббатхон замужем.  Супруг ее в данное время находится в Российской Федерации на заработках и по возможности каждый месяц  отправляет  жене денежные средства.    Мухаббатхон хочет сделать небольшой ремонт в своем доме и на полученный кредит планирует купить  строительные материалы.    Она благодарит "Арванд" за поддержку в решениях ее финансовых проблем.
texts.en:
Muhabbathon is a woman of 19 years living in a rural area. Muhabbathon works as a teacher in a kindergarten. In her free time on the weekends, she does sewing of women's national dresses. 

Muhabbathon is married. Her husband is presently in the Russian Federation earning a living and as possible sends money every month to his wife. 

Muhabbathon wants to make some repairs to their home and plans to use the loan to buy building materials. She thanks Arvand for the support in the resolution of her financial problems.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Малохат  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Раньше она шила женские национальные платья. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей женской одежды. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Malohat is a very hardworking and ambitious woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband receives a small salary. This salary is not enough to provide the family with all the necessary facilities. 

Malohat decided to help her husband for the good of the family. To that end, she took the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate.
