Now she may well start a business and become successful in this field. She used to sew women's national dresses. She wants to organize a business buying and selling women's clothing. 

With the proceeds, she plans to provide their children with a good education and high-calorie food. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 somoni to purchase goods in order to start a new business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes to start a new business

loans.name: Syrgabubu

texts.ru: Сыргабубу 57 лет, вдова мать, 3 детей.Все дети у заемщицы взрослые двое сыновей работают в РФ старший сын помогает ей.  По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный.  Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Сыргабубу её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом с  последующей реализацией скота. Начав этот бизнес в 1994 году с 500 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 10 голов овец и 30 коз, 1 лошадь и одна корова. Ежемесячный доход Сыргабубу составляет 5,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 60,000 KGS сом.Это её пятое обращение в компанию "Бай Тушум и Партнеры". На полученные средства она собирается закупить 12 голов овец.Сыргабубу поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи
texts.en:
Syrgabubu is a 57-year-old, widowed mother of three children. All the children are grown. Two sons are working in the Russian Federation and her eldest son helps her. 

By character, she is very nice, calm, and purposeful. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Syrgabubu has developed her business very well. She deals with the proceeds of fattening cattle. Having begun this business in 1994 with 500 KGS, she now has ten head of sheep and 30 goats, one horse, and one cow. 

The monthly income of Syrgabubu consists of 5,000 KGS som. She appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 KGS som. This is her fifth loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners. She is going to buy 12 head of sheep with the received amount. 

Syrgabubu shared with us that in the future she plans to renovate her home and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Shairkul

texts.ru: Шайыркул 57 лет, вдова мать, 5 детей.Все дети у заемщицы взрослые один сын работают в РФ старший сын и внучка помогает ей. Образование у Шайыркул среднее, после окончания школы помогала родителям и вышла замуж.По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Шайыркул её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом и последующей реализацией скота. Начав этот бизнес в 1998 году с 50,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 10 голов овец,1 лошадь и 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход Шайыркул составляет 5,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 100,000 KGS сом.Это её третье обращение в компанию "Бай Тушум и Партнеры". На полученные средства она собирается закупить 10 голов овец и 2 коровы. Шайыркул поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Shairkul is a 57-year-old, widowed mother of five children. All the children are grown and one son works in the Russian Federation. Her eldest son and granddaughter help her. Shairkul has a high school education. After graduating, she helped her parents and got married. 

By character, she is very kind, calm, and purposeful. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Shairkul has developed her business very well. She engages in fattening livestock. Begun in 1998 with 50,000 KGS, her business now has ten head of sheep, one horse, and two cows. 

Shairkul's monthly income consists of 5,000 KGS som. She appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS som. This is her third request to Bai-Tushum and Partners. 

She will use the received amount to buy ten head of sheep and two cows. Shairkul shared with us that in the future she plans to repair her home and to increase the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep for reselling

loans.name: Djumakan

texts.ru: Джумакан 62 года, воспитала 7 детей. Все дети Джумакан взрослые и семейные.Джумакан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес 32 года назад с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Джумакан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коров, 10 голов овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Также Джумакан обрабатывает 0,36 га земли, где выращивает кукурузу и 1,85 га поле где она выращивает сено который служит кормом для скота.В ведении бизнеса Джумакан помагает сын и муж. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Джумакан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Она мечтает расширить свое хозяйство для того чтобы улучшить условия жизни в будущем
texts.en:
Djumakan is 62 years old and has seven children. All of Djumakan's children are grown and married. As her main source of income for her family, Djumakan is engaged in field crops and livestock, having started this business 32 years ago with a sum of only 3,000 som (KGS ). Thanks to her hard work, Djumakan today has on her farm four cows and ten heads of sheep. 

The monthly income of the farm is about 8,000 som (KGS). Similarly, Djumakan works 0.36 hectares of land, where she grows corn, and a 1.85-hectare field where she grows hay that serves as food for the livestock. Djumakan's son and husband help in the business.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Djumakan appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and bull for fattening and resale. Djumakan plans to use income from the loan Доходы to further invest in her business. She dreams of expanding her farm in order to improve living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cows and bulls

loans.name: Tamarkan

texts.ru: Тамаракан 52 года, воспитала 6 детей. Тамаракан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается  животноводством, начав этот бизнес 34 года назад с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Тамаракан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы с телятами и 2 молодых теленка и 6 коз, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В ведении хозяйства Тамаракан помагает муж и младший сын которому 21 год, он единственные из детей который не женился.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тамаракан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Тамаракан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в этом году хотела бы провести капитальный ремонт дома женить младшего сына. И в будущем мечтает купить землю для дочери, чтобы она построила дом для себя и своей семьи.
texts.en: Tamarkan is 52 years old, she has raised six children. Tamarkan has been doing animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family, a business which she started 34 years ago with an amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Tamarkan now has two cows and two young calves, six goats and her monthly profit from the business is around 10,000 KGS. Her husband and youngest son who is only one from all the children who has still not married help her to run the business. With the goal to further grow her business Tamarkan has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 10,000 som to buy seep for feeding and resale. She plans to invest the profit from the loan into development of her business and also this year she wanted to have a total remodeling of her house and get her son married. In the future Tamarkan dreams to buy land for her daughter so that she can build a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for feeding and resale.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 34 years old and married. She has 1 daughter.

She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband earn money by running a business making and selling leather bags. Yen intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of materials and bag accessories.

Yen hopes her business runs smoothly so that she can improve her family's living conditions and save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories to manufacture bags.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy works hard to support her family. Precy is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
 
Precy requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Precy has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Precy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 56 years old, married and blessed with five children. He has been in the transport and cereal grinding businesses for the last 23 years which generate him a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has a good credit history and he is now servicing his eighth loan of KES 90,000 with KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy maize for grinding. With the profits he anticipates earning, he intends to educate his children. He hopes that one day he will be able to purchase a trailer for transport.

loans.use: To buy maize for grinding

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She cultivates bananas to sell to obtain income for the household. She is 50 years old, married and is raising her 4 dependents. She usually earns PHP 3,000 a month.

Sarah has been working in this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She aspires to expand and improve the business operations for better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. He describes himself as a visionary man. He provides transportation services by donkey. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located within a peri-urban area and his primary customers are local residents and businesspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate water for the donkey and his family members. He will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his 15 family members, including his extended family. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his second loan from SMEP DTM. In addition, Charles does farming to increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong earns an income by operating a general store in Ho Chi Minh. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Huong is requesting a new loan in order to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. She is confident that her new loan will assist her in eventually increasing the size of her store and to increase overall sales. 

Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new food and beverage products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Aneb

texts.en:
Aneb, age 25, farms crops and raises livestock together with his wife. They grow maize and keep cows, and they earn their income through the sale of produce and livestock. They have three children. 
 
Aneb looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his "business-in-a-box" (which comprises a smart phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village. This will be instrumental in helping all local farmers to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

Aneb is very excited about this opportunity to serve his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue operates a general store business. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She is now requesting a new loan in order to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, with which to stock her general store. Through this loan, she is confident that her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions. It will also enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, with which to stock her general store

loans.name: Rissa

texts.en:
Rissa is 40 years old, married, and has four adult children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She raises bananas, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She earns 3,000 PHP per month.  Her children help her in taking care of the bananas. 

Rissa is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 26 years old. She lives in Akhalkalaki District with her grandmother and two children. Her husband works abroad and sends his small income to his family.  Susanna requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, Susanna grows potatoes, barley and wheat on the family-owned land. The family sells the harvested products locally. Besides that, Susanna’s grandmother is a pensioner. The income is hardly enough, only for food and everyday expenses. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Susanna requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Susanna will purchase calves to start an animal husbandry business. She will place the cattle in a shed located in their yard, raise them, slaughter and sell the meat for a higher price. The increased profit will be reinvested in the animal husbandry business. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of the family

loans.use: to purchase calves for starting an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, age 44, operates a food stall business, where she prepares and sells food to people in her community. She has run her business for four years. She specializes in duck eggs and dishes made of raw fish and vegetables. 

Hang and her husband have two children. Her husband earns a living working as a building contractor. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City.  

Hang would like to request a loan in order to purchase high quality food ingredients for her business. She is confident that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She will also use part of her loan funds to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and be able to offer her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase high quality food ingredients for her business and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
This is Melecio, 24. He is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and lives with his parents to help them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melecio operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Melecio hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorela maintenance

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh operates a food stall business in Ho Chi Minh City. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. 

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of cakes to sell from her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract customers and satisfy customer demand. 

She is confident that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increase her sales, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of cakes to sell from her stall

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, age 28, has operated a general store business for the past four years. She lives with her husband and their one daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She would like to request a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of foods, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks, to offer for sale in her store. 

She is confident that this loan will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of foods, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks, to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 41, earns an income by operating a general store, where she sells a variety of food and home-use products. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns PhP 2,000 a month. She and her husband live in Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. They have two children.
 
Josephine joined GDMPC earlier this year. She is requesting a loan in the amount of of PhP 5,000 to purchase new items to sell in her store, such as candies, milo (grain sorghum), shampoo, and soap. 

She plans to set aside the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in her store, such as candies, milo (grain sorghum), shampoo, and soap

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is 27 years old. He is married and has three children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of livestock. They keep cows, goats and pigs. 

Asuman looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Asuman will save money for the veterinary medicine shop that he would like to open in his village. He would also like to purchase an artificial insemination kit to support his livestock business. He would like to accomplish these goals by 2015.

loans.use: to use technology to provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
This is Jasmine. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jasmine hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 33 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and a mother of two children. Cristy has a general store allowing her to gain an income of 8,000 PHP a month for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Cristy been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Cristy hopes to expand her business and aspires to improve her family standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is married with 5 children. She is 50 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal. Corazon owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Corazon has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC for a year. Corazon's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta earns a living by buying and selling fruit. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for 15 years. She earns an additional income from raising pigs. She lives with her family in Brookes Point, Palawan.

Violeta is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell in her store.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of fruit to offer for sale

loans.name: Danila

texts.es: La socia es la señora Danila, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa dedicándose  a la actividad artesanal, en la elaboración de elementos de cuero como monederos, carteras, bolsas, cinturones etc.  Principalmente para el mercado turístico del Cusco. Danila en esta como en anteriores oportunidades  está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como cuero. Hilos y accesorios. para la elaboración de sus productos, y  por todo ello, Danila está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su u actividad, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Señora Danila belongs to the "Los diamantes" (The Diamonds) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  The member continues to make a living through arts and crafts work by making leather products like purses, wallets, bags, belts, etc. mainly for the tourist market in Cusco.  As in previous opportunities, Danila is asking for the loan in order to buy material like leather, thread, and accessories for making her products. And for all of this, Danila is very grateful to Kiva for the support they provide her with and for helping her to uphold her work, which represents her main financial income and the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, and accessories for making her products.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Arca de Noe esta conformado por 9 integrantes todas  madres  solteras  con 24 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas pertenecen a la localidad del Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza  por ser una zona productora de cuajada, crema, leche, queso. Estas mujeres se han caracterizado por ser personas trabajadoras, luchadoras, gente humilde del campo, las cuales se unieron para poder optar al crédito en la modalidad del banco comunal, todas se conocen y se respalda mutuamente en sus diferentes negocios. Adrián Esperanza es la coordinadora la cual se encarga de velar por la responsabilidad de las integrantes en el cumplimiento de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Adriana tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de forma ambulante. Ella sala a las calles a vender una 10 horas diario bajo el intenso sol del día a día y con un  peso de su pana de uno 20 kg. Para darles el sustento a sus hijos y brindarles mejores oportunidades. Ella solicita el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de cuajada y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejoras sus ganancias. Adriana agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Arca de Noe (Noah’s Ark) communal bank has nine members. They are all single mothers with 24 children in their care. They are in Sauce which is located in northern part of the country. Sauce is an area known for the production cuajada (curd), cream, milk and cheese. These women have been characterized as hard-working, determined, humble people from the country. They came together in order to be eligible for a communal bank loan. They know each other and support each other with their businesses. Adriána Esperanza is the coordinator who is responsible for making sure the members make their payments on time. Adriana sells cuajada through a delivery service. She goes out to the streets to sell for ten hours a day under the intense sun with a weight of 20kg. She wants to give food and better opportunities to her children. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital for the purchase and sale of cuajada in order to satisfy the demands of her customers and to improve her earnings. Adriana is grateful for the help the Kiva investors give to poor people and countries like Nicaragua in order to give them a decent work environment.

loans.use: invest in working capital for buying and selling cuajada.

loans.name: Alcesido Norberto

texts.es:
Alcesido Norberto tiene 50 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

 Alcesido Norberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde muy joven. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza y pagar a los jornaleros. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar semillas, fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor ir de paseo, ir de compras. "Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Alcesido Norberto is 50 years old, in a committed relationship, and has one son. He lives with his partner and son in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. 

He is a member of the Jerusalen Communal Bank located in El Caimito I, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and gandul beans.

Alcesido Norberto has earned a living as a farmer growing corn and rice since he was quite young. He is seeking the loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weedkiller and to pay the day laborers. With the help of the loan he can buy seeds and fertilizers for the crops. He will buy and sell in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The challenges he faces are crop infestations, disease, and bad weather. 

His dream is to buy land to stay in farming. In his spare time he likes to play hard-surface soccer, go on outings and shop. He is very appreciative of the help afforded by the previous loan because he was able to buy what he needed for the crops and to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, urea and weedkiller, and to pay the day laborers.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  Nueva Esperanza esta conformado por 10 integrantes, todas mujeres madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Este banco es originario de León lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona turistas, universitaria con una de las mejores universidades del país. Con gente muy acogedora, trabajadoras con ganas de superación personal. Amanda del Socorro es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de los integrantes en cuanto a  los pagos y la ayuda mutua  con sus diferentes actividades económicas. Amanda del Socorro tiene por actividad  económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como  bolsitas de café, bolsitas de shapoo, bolsitas de salsa de tomate, jabón, leche, pan, frijoles, azúcar, detergente.  El banco comunal  Nueva Esperanza agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, all single mothers with 20 dependent children among them.  This bank is from León, a place located in the western part of the country. It is known as a tourist and university town, with one of the best universities in the country. Its people are welcoming and hardworking, and they are eager to succeed. 

Amanda del Socorro is the coordinator of the bank. She is responsible for seeing to it that the members make their payments on time and help one another in their different economic endeavors.  Amanda del Socorro has a small store in her home, where she sells products consumed daily in small quantities, such as a small containers of coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, soap, milk, bread, beans, sugar and detergent.

The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders  provide to people with few resources and to countries like Nicaragua so that its residents can have a means of attaining a decent life.

loans.use: to stock her small store by purchasing supplies such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, soap, milk, bread, beans, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: Manuel Agustín

texts.es:
Manuel Agustín tiene 21 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Manuel Agustín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas.
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es tener su propia casa y terrenos para trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boley y el indor.
texts.en:
Manuel Agustín is 21 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. 

He is a member of the Jerusalen Communal Bank is located in El Caimito I, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and gandul beans.

Manuel Agustín earns a living as a farmer growing corn and rice. He is seeking the loan to purchase to purchase insecticides, urea, liquid weedkiller and fertilizer. With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase farming supplies. 

He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The challenges he faces are crop infestations, disease and bad weather. 

His dream is to have his own home and land to work. In his spare time he likes to play volleyball and hard-surface soccer.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, urea, weedkiller and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.es:
Santa Marta se conformo desde el año 2008, están en su ciclo numero 16. Es un excelente grupo que  gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado continúan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Grisel es la presidenta de este grupo, ella vende prendas de todo tipo. Ha trabajo duro y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante. Sus compañeras también la apoyan y todas juntas están saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas como ser remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás.
texts.en: “Santa Marta” was formed in 2008 and are in cycle #16.  This is an excellent group thanks to the mutually supportive work they do continuing to work with the program to date.  Gisel is group president.  She sells all types of clothes.  She has worked hard and thanks to this has gotten ahead.  Her fellow members also support her and together they are all getting ahead.  She’s requesting the loan to buy clothes like t-shirts, pants, shirts and others.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES VICTORIOSAS” está en su décimo cuarto,  tiene 17 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades productivas donde todas se esfuerzan día tras día para poder brindar a sus familias un mañana diferente del que a ellas tocó vivir.
Sandra, una de estas mujeres, comenta que gracias a la ayuda de su grupo ha crecido mucho y está saliendo adelante.  Ella tiene una pequeña peluquería, que con el tiempo quiere ir agrandando para así tener mayores ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de spray, shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y demás insumos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Victoriosas” (Victorious Women) committee is in its 14th cycle with 17 members; they are from the Asunción area.  All of the members have productive activities where they all strive daily to provide their families with a better tomorrow than they themselves had.

Sandra is one of these women.  She comments that thanks to the group’s help she’s grown much and is moving forward.  She has a small barber shop that she wants to gradually enlarge over time to earn higher income and be able to help her family.  She requests this loan to buy hairspray, shampoo, rinses, hair color and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy hairspray, shampoo, rinses, hair color and other supplies.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, five rural poor women from Chhatapipal village of Bolangir district in Odisha, India, formed a group named Maa Sarala to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. 

Danda is one of them. The only sitting lady in the photograph is Danda. She is 32, very poor, and lives with her husband, three sons, age 15, 8 and 6, and one daughter, age 13. Her family belongs to the below poverty line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.
 
Danda has been running a general store in her small village for seven years with the help of her husband. She sells general grocery items like oil, sugar, lentils, biscuits, and stationery such as books, pens, etc. She was able to increase the varieties of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. Her monthly cash income from the existing business is around INR 4,000. Apart from this, she also gets some income in kind as the barter system is still prevailed in rural pockets. Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses. 

As per the statement, she was able to increase the varieties in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase stock of her business. So the loan amount will be used to purchase items like lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she replenishes her stock from the nearest town thrice in a week. Danda hopes to save enough money for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested.
 
The other four members of the group are Mamata, Saebani, Sita and Chanchala, who are running an electrical shop, a milk business, and a grocery shop.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Madres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Madres luchadoras tiene 17 miembros, todas ellas madres de familia, que se esfuerzan al máximo por sus hijos, por salir adelante y darles todo lo que tienen para un mejor día a día y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Gertrudis es parte de este grupo trabajador, ella se dedica a la venta de ensaladas de frutas, también hace jugar quiniela y vente frutas de caranday. Ella como se puede ver es una persona muy sacrificada y que quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo, ya que sabe que es la única forma de seguir sus sueños y lograr sus metas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de variedades de frutas y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo su ensalada de fruta que es su principal producto.
texts.en:
The 'Madres luchadoras' (hard-working women) committee has 17 members.  They are all mothers who work as hard as they can for their children.  They work to get ahead in life and to provide their children with everything they need to live a better life without hardships.

Gertrudis is a member of this hard-working group.  Her business is selling fruit salads.  She also sells lottery tickets and caranday fruit.  As you can see, she is a very hard-working woman who would like to make progress in life through her work.  She knows that this is the only way to follow her dreams and achieve her goals. 

Gertrudis is requesting this loan to buy a variety of fruit so that she can continue making fruit salad which is her main product.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of fruit for making fruit salads

loans.name: Dougouyiriwaton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Dougouyiriwaton 2 ont  en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Nikankan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres, de céréales et des habits. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Koniba  (1 ère femme debout T-shirt noir rayé de bleu) excelle dans la vente de l’arachide. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,   3 sacs d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de Kimparana.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Koniba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 8500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en: Mostly married and living in traditional extended families, the seven women of Dougouyiriwaton 2 Group have an average age of 43 and five children. They all live in the village of Nikankan in Segou, the 4th largest administrative region in Mali. They know each other via neighborhood ties, work, and kinship. They buy and sell all sorts of condiments, cereals, and clothing. In order to satisfy increasingly numerous and demanding customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Ms. Koniba (first woman standing in the black t-shirt with blue stripes) excels at selling peanuts.  She is very sought-after.  She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of peanuts from the fair in Kimparana. She makes her sales for cash to a retail clientele of women and men. With this loan, Ms. Koniba hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 8,500 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to help her spouse take care of household expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Nipagagnon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Nipagagnon 1 ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de kafono dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  HAWA (1 ère femme debout de la  droite  vers gauche) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 12 paquets de maggi 3 boites de concentrée de tomate, 2 sac de sel 50 kg d’oignons.  elle s’approvisionne à la foire de KOUTIALA.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame HAWA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en: Mostly married and living in traditional extended families, the seven women of Nipagagnon 1 Group have an average age of 41 and six children. They all live in the village of Kafono in Segou, the 4th largest administrative region in Mali. They know each other via neighborhood ties, work, and kinship. They buy and sell all sorts of condiments.  In order to satisfy increasingly numerous and demanding customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Ms. Hawa (first woman standing, from right to left, in the photo) excels at selling condiments. She is very sought-after. She plans to use her loan to buy 12 packages of Maggi seasoning, 3 boxes of tomato concentrate, 2 bags of salt, and 50 kg of onions from the fair in Koutiala. She makes her sales for cash to a retail clientele of women and men. With this loan, Ms. Hawa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to help her spouse take care of household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a greenhouse

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 27 years old and married.  She is the mother of one child who is six years old. She is still running her clothing business, which has been in operation for five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is servicing her fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully.  She intends to purchase more clothing for resale. 

The profits will be used to purchase a dairy cow.  She hopes for a bright future and success in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself as a humble and caring man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as sugar, tea leaves, cooking oil, flour, bread, ground nuts, drinking chocolate, and so on. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located within a busy and area with much business potential, and his primary customers are local residents, He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 8,700 KES loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by the seven members of his family. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He previously took a loan of 40,000 KES, which he paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 25 years old, married and a mother of two children. She sells fruits and vegetables in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about 5,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she has applied for a loan of 11,000 KES from KADET LTD to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. Zawadi will use the additional income to provide for basic needs for her family and help pay school fees for her children. 

The client intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day that she will come to own a well-established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma earns a living by selling home-cooked food to the people in her place. She is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. Norma has been in the business for 10 years now.

Norma wants to avail a loan to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, flour, cooking oil and others for her food vending business. In the future, Norma dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, flour, cooking oil and others for her food vending business

loans.name: Bwogi

texts.en:
Bwogi is 29 years old. He is married and has three children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, cassava, passion fruit, bananas, sweet potatoes and pineapples. They keep chickens and pigs. They also earn money by producing and selling charcoal and bricks.

Bwogi looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Bwogi will grow his farming business. He has set the following five-year-goals for himself: 
1. to start a cattle rearing business
2. to start a poultry rearing business
3. to offer agricultural warehousing services to his village
4. to launch a water sanitation project in his village

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and scale so that he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 33 years old, from a small village in the Tsalka district. She lives with her husband, 3 children (10, 14 and 16 years old) and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. 
The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 9 milk cows. Natela also owns a 0.7 hectare agricultural plot of land, where she sows potatoes. The harvested potatoes and milk are sold locally in an open market at a good price. Natela is a very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Natela has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, Natela will be able to increase the income of her family. With increased income, their living conditions will be improved. Natela awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow.

loans.name: Jelito

texts.en: Jelito's main source of income comes from his banana growing business. He is 44 years old and married with 2 kids. He is from Poblacion, Balinagao and has been gardening for seven years, earning PHP 6,000 per month. Recently, Jelito joined GDMPC. Jelito is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 50-year-old widow. She is blessed with one child, aged 20. She sells children's jackets by hawking them in town. She has been running the business for five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed her second loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to construct a stall for selling clothes and to purchase more clothing for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her child, who is in college. Her dreams are to improve her standard of living and to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to construct a stall for selling clothes.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is taking out a new loan to expand his fish-selling business. With it he will buy a stock of fish and a refrigerator, the latter of which will allow him to stock more fish for longer periods and hence increase his sales. Thanks to the loans he is getting from Yehu and Kiva, Patrick has been able to make home improvements. He says that the previous loan enabled him to expand his house and provide a better quality life to his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorela maintenance.

loans.name: Good Starter Development Group

texts.en:
Rose, a married woman with four children and a dependent, operates a restaurant in a fairly busy trading centre where she works six hours a day. Her main customers are passersby, especially market goers; she also does small-scale farming, a venture that she started in 1996.

Rose will use her portion of the loan to buy food items such as plantain, rice, and posho for the restaurant. The profits will be used to finance her children's necessities and school fees. A very hardworking woman, she hopes to build a house of her own in the future.

loans.use: to buy food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Boniflide

texts.en:
Boniflide, 32, is a widow. She has three children between the ages of 10 and 14. They all go to school. 

To make a living, Boniflide sells trousers. She has been running this business for the past six years. With this loan, she wants to buy more trousers to sell. She will use the profits from the business to buy iron sheets for roofing her house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers to sell.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comunal Luz Divina está conformado por 8 integrantes todas mujeres en las edades comprendidas de 25 a 55 años de edad. Madres solteras con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El Sauce es un lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, crema. Son mujeres que se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, de buenas costumbres con ganas de superación personal, a la misma vez mujeres muy sencillas, humilde de pueblo con muchas ganas de brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor. María Inés es la coordinadora del banco comunal Luz  Divina la cual tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de Marie Inés es trabajar unas 12 horas al día. Ella se levanta a la 4: am a preparar la nisquesa del maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas. El financiamiento lo necesita para  comprar materia prima de trabajo  como maíz, leña, gas, bolsas plásticas. Cal. El banco comunal Luz Divina agradece la ayuda que los inversionista  kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Luz Divina (Divine Light) communal bank is made up of eight members; all women between the ages of 25 and 55 years old, and single mothers with 15 children under their responsibility.  They are from El Sauce, a place located in the northern region of the country.  El Sauce is known for being an area that produces milk, curd, and cream.  

These are women known for being responsible, hard-working, and well mannered, with the desire for personal improvement.  At the same time they are very sincere and humble people with a great desire to offer their children a better future.

María Inés is the coordinator of the Luz Divino communal bank whose way of earning a living is by making and selling tortillas.  The business she has is located in her home.  María Inés' daily routine is to work 12 hours a day.  She gets up at 4:00 am to prepare the corn for making the tortillas.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, gas, and plastic bags.  

The Luz Divina communal bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy raw material like corn, firewood, gas, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Banco Comunal En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal en Dios Confiamos esta conformado por 12 integrantes, todos mayores de edad casados, con  30 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que se encuentra en la zona norte de país. Este personas se han caracterizado por ser responsables en sus pagos en los créditos demostraron su calidad moral de pago en tiempo y forma. En el caso de  Luisa Yhoana es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de velar por la responsabilidad de cada uno de los integrantes y motivarlos a apoyarse mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Luisa tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos  en pie, negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y ha logrado tener clientes fijos y eventuales. Luisa esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y compra un lote de cerdos que se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio. Esto con el objetivó de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Luisa Yhoana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The En Dios Confiamos Communal Bank is made up of 12 members, all married adults with 30 dependent children among them. These members are natives of Malpaisillo, which is located in the northern part of the country.

These people are known to be responsible in their loan payments and have demonstrated their moral character by paying on time. Luisa Yhoana is the coordinator of the group and is entrusted with seeing to it that each member is responsible and of motivating them to support each other in their economic endeavors. 

Luisa raises and sells live pigs, a business that is located at her home. She has both fixed and casual customers. She is requesting funding to invest in working capital and purchase a batch of pigs, which is being offered at a good price. She is doing this to satisfy her customers’ demands and improve her income. 

Luisa Yhoana is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that its citizens can have decent livelihoods

loans.use:
to have the working capital to buy a batch of pigs for sale and butchering
of same.

loans.name: Sayro Joel

texts.es:
Sayro Joel  tiene 21 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija, vive con el conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. 

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Sayro Joel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es tener casa propia, comprar una finca y mejorar los ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir en familia y jugar indor y divertirce con los amigos.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Sayro Joel is 21 years old and lives with his common law wife, with whom he has a daughter. They live in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios Province.

Sayro Joel is a member of Jerusalen Communal Bank, which is located in Caimito I precinct, belonging to Puerto Pechiche parish, in Puebo Viejo canton. This communal bank is dedicated to agriculturists who do short cycle farming of corn, rice and pigeon peas.

He cultivates corn and rice. He is requesting a loan to purchase insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and compost. With help from the loan he will be able to purchase fertilizer for his fields. He will make his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios Province. The challenges he faces are pest infestations and bad climate.

He dreams of having his own house, of buying a farm and of improving his income. In his free time he enjoys sharing with his family and playing indoor games and having fun with his friends.

Sayro Joel is very grateful for the help he received in his previous loan because he was able to buy what he needed for his fields and improved his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and compost.

loans.name: Eika Patricia

texts.es: Erika de 38 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo y se dedica a ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento personal en su negocio de peluquería. Ella es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijas en las edades de 6 y 13 años, a quienes sueña ver convertidos en adultos exitosos. Erika tiene 3 años de experiencia en su trabajo, el cual es producto de su aptitud por la belleza y la estética, por eso cuando pensó en emprender una microempresa,  lo hizo pensando en lo que mas le gustara. En su negocio ofrece servicios de alisado, peinado, pedicure, manicure, cortes de cabello, usualmente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y muchas veces hasta mas tarde. Sus principales clientes son familiares, vecinos, amigos y muchos referidos de sus amigos, quienes no dudan en recomendar la calidad de sus servicios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará un lava cabezas, que le permitirá disminuír los tiempos de servicio y mejorar la imagen de su negocio. Su meta es tener un local propio, bien condicionado donde su clientela encuentre un ambiente mucho más confortable y opte por regresar para ser asesorada y/o expresar una imagen personal o profesional de mucha calidad.
texts.en:
Erika, 38, lives in the municipality of Malambo and earns a living offering personal improvement services in her beauty salon business. She is a married woman with two children aged six and 13 whom she dreams of seeing as successful adults. Erika has three years of experience in her work which arose out of her talent for beauty and grooming. Thus when she thought about starting a micro-business she decided on what she enjoyed the most. In her business she offers hair straightening, hair styling, pedicures, manicures and hair cuts, usually from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. and often later. Her primary customers are family members, neighbors, friends and many referrals from her friends who do not hesitate to recommend her for the quality of her services. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a shampoo chair and basin which will allow her to reduce service time and improve her business's image. Her goal is to have her own well-outfitted establishment where her customers may enjoy a much more comfortable environment and choose to come back for consulting and/or expressing a very high-quality personal or professional image.

loans.use: to purchase a shampoo chair and basin for her salon.

loans.name: Wuilliam Armando

texts.es:
Wuilliam, se dedica a la ganadería de repasto y vacas lecheras, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando, su ganadería la ha tenido desde muy joven, es un negocio de familia, trabaja todos los días.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto y concentrado, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar su ganadería y tener más beneficios.
La aspiración de Wuilliam es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor vida y apoyarles en el estudio.
texts.en:
Wuilliam earns a living raising pastured livestock and dairy cattle. He is 38 years old, married and has two children who currently are in school. He has had his livestock business since he was very young. It is a family business and he works seven days a week. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase cattle for grazing and concentrate. This purchase will help him increase his herd and make greater profits. Wuilliam's aspiration is to strengthen the business and offer his children a better quality of life and to support them in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for grazing and concentrate.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
ESTE CLIENTE CUENTA CON MAS DE 40 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS FERRETEROS. CON DICHO NEGOCIO A SACADO A DELANTE A SU FAMILIA DE LA CUAL YA SOLAMENTE MANTIENE A SU ESPOSA POR QUE SUS HIJOS YA CULMINARON LOS ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIO GRACIAS AL ESFUERZO DE SU PADRE Y EL NEGOCIO.
EN CUANTO A LA SOLICITUD DE CREDITO LA NESECITA PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA YA QUE SE APROXIMA LA TEMPORADA ALTA EN VENTAS QUE ES LA DE FIN DE AÑO
texts.en:
This member has over 40 years of experience in the sale of hardware items by means of which he supports his family. Currently he is supporting only his wife since his children have already finished their university studies thanks to their father's effort and the business. 

With regards to the loan application, he needs the loan to purchase merchandise such as extension cords, spark plugs, wrenches and padlocks, since the high-sales season is approaching with the end of the year.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his hardware business.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes de  49 anos de edad, casada con 4 hijos de 27, 26, 23,18 anos, de los cuales solamente el  menor esta bajo su responsabilidad esta estudiando. María Luisa es originaria del  departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La actividad económica de María Lourdes es vender productos varios que consisten en venta de tortillas, refresco, pan, comida corriente a trabajadores de una hacienda cafetalera de la localidad. Negocio que esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene siete anos de desempeñarse en dicho negocio. En los créditos anteriores la Sra. Ha demostrad su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar productos como maíz, arroz, pan, frijoles para elaborar comidas a los trabajadores cafetaleros ya que se acerca la temporada de café y necesita satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Y aprovechar las ventas y los ingresos. María Lourdes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Lourdes, 49, is married with four children of 27, 26, 23, 18 years of age of whom only the youngest is in her care as a student. María Luisa is a native of the Chinandega department, a place located in the country's western region. Her business activity is selling a variety of products including tortillas, drinks, bread, and traditional foods to the workers from a coffee plantation in the area. Her business is located in her living quarters and she has worked in this line of business for seven years. 

Ms. María Lourdes has demonstrated responsibility in the repayment of her previous loans. She needs the loan to purchase such items as corn, rice, bread and beans for making meals for the coffee workers since the coffee season is approaching and she must meet her customers' needs, as well as take advantage of the sales to make an income. 

María Lourdes appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support they offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua that they may have a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, corn, bread and sugar for making meals for the area's coffee workers.

loans.name: Mahamadi

texts.fr:
Mr  MAHAMADI est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  4ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il envisage après études  ouvrir un cabinet d’étude.
texts.en:
Mahamadi is single and has no children. He has been a student in the professional Master I at the Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou Graduate School of Public Works) for four years. This school is reputed for its training in civil engineering in the country.

Mahamadi would like to finance his studies. 

He does relevant internships during his vacation to acquire professional experience. 

After his studies, he hopes to open a consultancy firm.

loans.use: to finance his higher education

loans.name: Delwende Ismael

texts.fr:
Mr  D ISMAEL est célibataire sans enfant.

Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.

Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.

Il envisage après les  études  travailler. Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle.
texts.en:
D. Ismael is single and has no children. He has been a student in the professional Master I at the Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works) for 3 years. This school is reputed in the country for its training in civil engineering.

D. Ismael wants to finance his education.

During vacations, he does relevant internships to acquire professional work experience.

He hopes to work after his studies.

loans.use: to finance his higher education

loans.name: Mahamadi

texts.fr:
Mr  MAHAMADI est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  4ans.  Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il envisage après les études, être ingénieur et servir sa nation.
texts.en:
Mahamadi is a single man with no children. He has been a student in the Master I professional class at the Ecole Superieure de Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou (ESTPO; Ouagadougou Superior School of Public Works) for the past four years. The ESTPO is the top higher education institution for civil engineering training in the country of Burkina Faso. Mahamadi is currently seeking a loan in order to finance his studies there.

He performs his practical, on-the-job training during the holidays so that he can acquire professional work experience. After graduation, Mahamadi envisages becoming an engineer so that he can serve his country.

loans.use: to finance his higher education and become an engineer.

loans.name: Belgique Group

texts.fr:
Mme MINATA est responsable du  groupe BELGIQUE.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé à 37 ans et le moins âgé a 18 ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a deux (02) personnes  en charge.

Mme vend des produits pharmacopées et des tisanes depuis 17 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes (bébé).

Elle veut s’acheter les produits pharmacopées (un mélange) pour 01sac et demi.

Elle  veut améliorer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Son ambition  est toujours d’aider les enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Mrs Minata is the leader of the Belgiqque group. She is well. She is married with seven children. The oldest is 37 years old and the youngest 18. Two of them attend school and are dependent on her.

Mrs Minata has been selling pharmaceutical products and herbal teas for 17 years. She buys her stock in Ghana. Her customers are men and women (with babies).

She wishes to buy one and a half sacks of pharmaceutical products (a mixture).

She plans to improve her business with the profits. Her aim is still to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy one and a half sacks of mixed pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Keynne Salvador

texts.fr:
Mr KEYNNE SALVADOR est célibataire sans enfants.
Il est étudiant à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou) en classe de MASTER I professionnel depuis 02ans. L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en  génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures. 
Il fait des stages  pratiques  pendant les vacances afin d’acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Mr veut travailler après ses études dans une multinationale comme ingénieur et fonder une famille de 04 membres.
texts.en:
Mr. KEYNNE SALVADOR is single without children. He is enrolled at the ESTPO (Graduate School of Public Works of Ouagadougou), and has been a student in the MASTER I program for professionals for the past two years. The ESTPO is a reference school for civil engineering education in the country. 

Mr. Keynne Salvador wishes to finance his graduate studies. He spends his time off getting on-the-job training to acquire practical experience. After graduation, he wants to work as an engineer for a multinational corporation. He also wants a family of four.

loans.use: to finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr BOUBACAR est célibataire sans enfants.
Il est étudiant à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou) en classe de MASTER I professionnel depuis 03ans. L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en  génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures. 
Mr dit être  déjà ingénieur des travaux et qu’il est déjà sur le terrain. Il dit vouloir poursuivre ses études afin d’acquérir plus de connaissances pour travailler en entreprise.
texts.en:
BOUBACAR is single and has no children.

He has been a student at the Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou (ESTPO) for three years now and is working on a professional Master I degree. ESTPO is renowned in our country for its training of civil engineers. 

BOUBACAR wants to be able to finance his studies.

He says that he is already an engineer and already works as an engineer. He wants to continue his studies in order to increase his knowlegde for working in a company.

loans.use: to finance his higher education

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est célibataire sans enfants.

Elle est étudiante à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou) en classe de Licence III  professionnel depuis 02ans. L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en  génie civil dans notre pays.

Mme veut financer ses études supérieures. 

Mme souhaite obtenir un emploi stable après ses études. Plus tard si les moyens la permettent, elle désir ouvrir un bureau d’étude et travailler pour son propre compte.
texts.en:
Mme Haoua is single, without children.

She has been a student at the Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou (ESTPO) or the Graduate School for Public Works in Ouagodougou for two years. ESTPO is a well known school for civil engineering in our country.

Mma Haoua wants to pay for her higher education costs.

She wishes to obtain a stable job after her studies. Later, if her means allow her to, she would like to open a design office and work for herself.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Jean-Stephane

texts.fr:
Mr  JEAN STEPHANE est célibataire sans enfant.

Il est étudiant en classe de Licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.

Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.

 Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il envisage après études  travailler fonder une belle famille.
texts.en:
Jean Stephane is single, and has no children. He is a student in his third year of a professional degree program at ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), and has been on this course for three years. He is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in the country. He wants to finance his higher education studies.

Jean Stephane carries out practical work experience placements during the holidays, because he wants to gain professional experience. Once he finishes his studies, he plans to have a beautiful family.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: Wilfried Leon Blaise

texts.fr:
Mr  WILFRIED L B  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans.  Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après ses études, il compte travailler.
texts.en:
Wilfried L.B. is a single man with no children.

For the past three years, he has been working toward his Bachelor's degree at the "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou," (Ouagadougou School of Public Works,) a professional training school for civil engineers in Burkina Faso. He wants to finance his higher education.
 
He does practical internships during school vacations to gain professional experience. After his studies, he intends to work.

loans.use: to finance his higher education.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 57 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years.  She earns additional income as an Avon dealer.

Ofelia is requesting her seventeenth loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to  sell. Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make hollow blocks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 43-year-old married man and a father of two young children ages 12 and 10. He has run a sari-sari or variety store business for almost five years now in Bien Unido, Bohol. 
Samuel is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as bread and biscuits, soap and shampoo, and toiletries. 
Samuel is optimistic that if the loan is granted, he will be able to improve his store and attract more customers and buyers, which will improve his sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as bread and biscuits, soap and shampoo, and toiletries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Rowena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Mirikah

texts.en:
