Mirikah is 30 years old, a single mother of two children. She has been operating a green grocery business for the past five years in Narok market, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to expand her store as well as add more stock of assorted vegetables for sale.

She intends to use the profits earned to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plan is to become a large-scale outlet.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store and add more stock of assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 56 years old, married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vitaliana has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Vitaliana requested a PHP 25,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing nets, bamboo, etc.

Vitaliana has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Vitaliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of additional fishing equipment like fishing nets, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is 29 years old, from a small village in the Tsalka district. She lives with her 3-year-old daughter. Zeinab is involved in agricultural activities. She has 2 milk cows and a 0.3 hectare plot of agricultural land, where she sows potatoes. Zeinab sells the harvested potatoes and milk locally in an open market at a good price. She is very hardworking woman who does her best to ensure a good harvest. Zeinab requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, she will be able to increase the income of her family. With increased income their living conditions will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 54, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a carpenter. She is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma dreams of having a good life and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Semporiana

texts.en:
Semporiana is a 52-year-old merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a variety store for several years now. Semporiana sells various goods to the people in her community.
Semporiana has been a member of CEVI for sometime now. She joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan to buy more prodcuts to sell such as dry goods, candies, seasonings, chips, and snack foods.
Semporiana dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as dry goods, candies, seasonings, chips, and snack foods.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 52-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and three daughters.
For the past seven years, Omar has had a stall for making and selling fresh juices such as orange juice, pomegranate juice, lemon juice and others. Omar is famous among customers because of the fresh and delicious fruit juices he makes, which are highly requested by customers. This demand makes the project a profitable one, but Omar needs more support to cover the rest of the costs.
Omar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing another stall for his elder son, so he can make and sell fresh fruit juices to customers like his father. This will expand the family's project, which is their only source of income. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Omar is photographed next to his stall while he is making fresh juices to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a new stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Violeta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb, age 41, operates a poultry business where he sells chickens and eggs. He has been involved in this work for nine years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He and his wife have four children, with ages ranging from four to 12 years. 

Caleb describes himself as determined and hard-working. He reports that his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. His business goal is to be a primary supplier of chickens within five years. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was in the amount of Kes 50,000. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of Kes 21,000 in order to purchase a water tank for his household. It will be used by his six family members and will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Bayarmaa is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Davaasuren, age 23, provides transportation service within the area. 

Bayarmaa has been working at a retail store that sells auto oil and related materials, since 2004. She has been managing the store since then and has mastered the business. She is planning to buy that auto oil store and run it by herself, as owner. She has already talked with her boss and agreed to buy that store, and she needs a loan of 3,580,000 MNT. She will use the loan capital to invest in her auto oil store purchase, and to buy inventory to run the business normally. She is a helpful, welcoming and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy the auto oil store where she works, and to purchase inventory to run the business normally.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 26 years old. He lives in Batumi, with his wife and aunt. Lasha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has their income from a newly-started business in their local town. Lasha has a bakery, where breads are baked and sold in Batumi. The income from this bakery is hardly enough to cover only food and everyday expenses for three people. Because the income is not enough for the family, Lasha decided to start-up a new business with the requested loan.

His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lasha will purchase an additional local bakery, where he will bake Khachapuri (Georgian “cheese bread’’). This is a very popular traditional food among Georgians. Khachapuri will be sold with the breads from Lasha's first bakery, and this will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a bakery where he will bake Georgian "cheese bread" to sell along with breads from his first bakery.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet, 59, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Nguyet started a cafe 20 years ago. She sells coffee, soft drinks and instant food for people in her community.

Now, she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of beverages to sell at her cafe and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of beverages to sell at her cafe.

loans.name: Enemesia

texts.en:
Enemesia, age 50, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this work for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Enemesia is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, age 55, runs a general store business in front of her home. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years. She and her husband, who works in a bakery, have three sons and one daughter. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Loan started her venture with the goal of helping to cover household expenses and to generate sufficient income to raise her children. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying more household items and a greater variety of soft drinks with which to stock her store. She is confident that this will enable her to attract more customers and to increase the turnover of her business. 

Through this loan, she intends to expand her business activities and to gain capital, which she will use to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and a greater variety of soft drinks with which to stock her store

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en: Veronique is 62 years old. She is a widow with four children. She sells vegetables and has been running that business for 2 years. With this loan, she wants to buy more tomatoes and spices for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and spices to sell.

loans.name: Quan

texts.en:
Quan operates a food stall business to earn her living. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

She would like to request a new loan in order to continue her current business of selling bread and pork from her stall. She is confident that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. 

She is hopeful that through this loan, she will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase good quality pork and bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed for preparing hot dogs, sticky rice, and other snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Momoe

texts.en: Momoe is a 22-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Momoe has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, a shovel, chemicals, wheelbarrow, bush knives,etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits,Momoe hopes to pay her children's school fees..

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, a shovel, chemicals, wheelbarrow, bush knives,etc

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha operates a fishing business to earn a living. She is widowed and works hard to support her family. She has been engaged in her business for nine years.

Juditha is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will utilize the loan funds to buy a fishing net for her business.

In the future, Juditha would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, 50, sells vegetables and has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan requested, she will buy more eggplant, tomatoes and green beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more eggplant, tomatoes and green beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy clothes to sell at her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang operates a general store business to earn her living. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Hang is now requesting a new loan in order to buy a range of new products, primarily food and beverages, with which to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.

She is confident that this loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store, increasing her sales, and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, primarily food and beverages, with which to restock her general store

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Lylebeth

texts.en:
Lylebeth is 35 years old and married with three children.

Lylebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of coconut meat to sell.

Lylebeth has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her dried coconut meat business for four years and also earns an income buying and selling bananas and coconut shells and running a general store.

Lylebeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette, age 24, sells utensils to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the last five years. Her husband provides motorcycle transportation services, and they support the family together. 

Jeannette is requesting a loan in order to buy more utensils to offer for sale. 

The expected profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: o buy utensils to offer for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Esther, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continua dedicándose  a la venta de tamales de forma ambulatoria, Esther realiza este oficio hace muchos años y con este ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y educar a sus hijos.
Esther en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carne, maíz, maní, cebollas, sal, azucar y especias para la elaboración de sus tamales, y  por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su u actividad, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The member, Esther, belongs to Los Diamantes Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues making a living selling tamales as a street vendor.  She has done this job for many years and has been able to get her family ahead and educate her children.

Esther is requesting this loan to buy ingredients such as meat, corn, peanuts, onions, salt, sugar, and spices to make her tamales.

She's very grateful to Kiva for the support it gives her and for helping her keep her job, which represents her family's main income and support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de 32 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 15 años en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias; allí se dedica a la venta de alimentos cárnicos, en una pequeña infraestructura que desearía mejorar, para poder alcanzar un mayor número de clientes. Su experiencia data de hace 6 años, cuando aprovechando que su esposo trabajaba en una empresa dedicada a la cría y comercialización de pollos, decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios. Hoy sus principales productos son carnes de res, pollos y carnes frías, los cuales vende por unidad o por libras, mediante el sistema de crédito o de contado de acuerdo a cada cliente. Sus principales compradores son los vecinos de su sector y el mayor volumen de ventas lo tiene usualmente en el mes de Diciembre y durante las festividades que se realizan en la ciudad, como fiestas carnavaleras, religiosas etc . En la actualidad se acercan las navidades y las fiestas de año nuevo, por eso su demanda se incrementa mientras su capital de trabajo se nota disminuido,  para poder comprar un congelador que le permita almacenar un mayor volumen de productos cárnicos  en óptimas condiciones  y responder al incremento de sus pedidos en temporadas en las cuales se incrementan las ventas. Esta es la razón principal por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un congelador de dos puertas y un mayor volumen de pollos y de carnes, con los cuales espera mejorar sus ingresos, teniendo bien almacenados y de manera constante los productos que ella ofrece, para finalmente cumplir su sueño de tener una casa propia, pues ya se encuentra  ahorrando la cuota inicial para empezar a cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 32, lives with her husband and two children, ages 14 and 15, in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  There she earns a living selling meat in a small infrastructure that she would like to improve in order to be able to reach a greater number of customers.  Her experience dates back 6 years to when, taking advantage of her husband working in a company dedicated to raising and selling chickens, she decided to start her own business venture.  Today her principal products are beef, chicken, and cold cuts, which she sells whole or by the pound, on credit or for cash, depending on the customer.  Her principal buyers are the residents of her neighborhood and the largest volume of sales is usually in the month of December during the festivities that take place in the city, such as carnival parties, religious celebrations, etc.    

Currently Christmas and the New Year’s holidays are approaching so the demand has increased while her working capital is too diminished to buy a freezer that will permit her to store a larger volume of meat products in optimum conditions and to respond to the increase in her orders during the periods when sales rise.  This is the principal reason for acquiring a Kiva loan, her second through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy a freezer with two doors and a larger volume of chickens and meats.  By having her products well stored and consistently available, she hopes to increase her earnings and finally realize her dream of having her own home.  She is already saving for the down payment to start fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to buy a two-door freezer and a larger volume of chicken and meat.

loans.name: Anne Alicia

texts.es: Anne Alicia de 44 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos de 21, 23,26 anos de edad todos mayores. Ella  originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Chinandega se caracteriza por ser una zona comercialmente productiva.  Anne tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general. El negocio consiste en vender productos como cosmético, perfumería, pantalones, faldas, short, blusas,  ropa de cama, el cual vende de contado y de crédito. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 anos que se desempeña en el negocio. Los desafíos y problemas que enfrentan como familia es con su hijo mayor ya que él tiene ya que él es una personas especial y depende totalmente de su madre en cuido, atenciones, y económicamente. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso propia para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, y gastos medico de su hijo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con mercadería ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y la venta se incrementa y poder dar respuesta  a sus clientes. Anne agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Anne Alicia, 44, is married with three children of the ages of 21, 23 and 26, all of them grown. She is a native of the department of the Chinandega which is located in the country's western region. Chinandega is characterized by being a commercially productive region. Anne's business is the sale of general merchandise. The business consists of selling products such as cosmetics, perfumes, pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, and bedclothes which she sells for cash or credit. She has her business located in her living quarters and has been in business for five years. The challenges and problems she faces with her family are with her elder son since he is a person with special needs and depends on his mother entirely for his care and financial support. The business came about out of the necessity of having her own source of income in order to help with household costs and her son's medical expenses. 

She needs the loan to increase her working capital and stock her business with merchandise since the Christmas season is approaching when sales go up and she must be ready to respond to her customers. Anne appreciates the help given by the Kiva lenders to persons of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua that they may have dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, and bedclothes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en: Erneste, aged 28, is married with one child, aged three years. Erneste sells used shoes and has been selling shoes for the past 12 years. With the loan, he will buy more used shoes for sale. The profits for the loan will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung operates a general store business to earn an income. She is a previous borrower, and her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Nhung is requesting a new loan in order to buy a range of products to restock her store. These will include beverages and a greater quantity of basic products such as snack foods. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

She is confident that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store and increasing sales, and that it will also help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and a greater quantity of basic products such as snack foods with which to stock her general store

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc would like to take out a further loan to buy more furniture, appliances, and high quality ingredients so that she can sell better food from her stall. Cuc's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture, appliances, and high quality ingredients.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a lady aged 58 years old, married, and blessed with 10 children between 16 and 35 years old. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for a period of nine years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Sarah has borrowed a loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her fourth loan, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She wishes to use this amount to purchase tealeaves, sugar, salt, and cooking fat for resale.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay school fees for her school-going children. 

In the future, she wishes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase tealeaves, sugar, salt, and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Faaotaota

texts.en:
Faaotaota is 56 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling chips in her community, and has been doing this for many years. 

Faaotaota has requested a loan to buy a big fryer, a bag of flour, oil, sugar, baking soda, and yeast. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Faaotaota will save part of the profits from her business to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a big fryer, a bag of flour, oil, sugar, baking soda, and yeast.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ligaya hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy sewing equipment and materials. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose wants to make a new investment to expand on her existing business. She is requesting a new loan to buy more sacks of dry fish.

With the last loan, she was able to increase profits through increased sales. With this loan she is sure to have more sales to increase her income and have a more prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase more omena (dried fish) for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old and married with six children.  She supports her needs, and presently resides at Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She has engaged in this type of business for ten years, and earns a monthly net income of PHP 2,000.00. She requested loan of three thousand pesos to purchase additional fishing net.

She has been a new member of PMPC with good a credit record, and hopes to expand her existing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Hyacinthe

texts.en:
Hyacinthe is 30 years old. She sells juices and biscuits, and has been in the business for the past two years. She would like to get this loan to buy more juice for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used for making more investments.

loans.use: to buy more juices for sale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a fruit vendor. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has operated her business for ten years. She also runs a small general store business to earn additional income.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase a stock of fruits to offer for sale.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, age 55, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 500 in sales every day.

Liza and her husband Reynaldo live in Intramuros, Manila, with their children. She and Reynaldo manage their household while operating the business. Liza is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages with which to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza dreams of offering her children a good, high quality education and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages with which to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Yoconda Karina

texts.es:
YOCONDA KARINA tiene 22 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 1 año y medio, vive con el hijo en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

YOCONDA KARINA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza y pagar a mano de obra.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es falta de recursos económicos. El sueño es que el negocio prospere. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarce a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Yoconda Karina is a 22-year-old single mother. She and her 1-and-a half-year-old son live in the city of Ventanas. In her free time, she enjoys farming.

Yoconda is a member of the agricultural communal bank VRC AVANZA. All of its members live in a part of the city named Agua Frías and work in farming and raising livestock. Yoconda practically grew up in this region. She makes a living growing corn and rice.

Yoconda is requesting this loan buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed-killer, and to pay hired labor. This will enable her to buy fertilizer in time for her next planting. Purchases and sales take place in the city of Ventanas every two weeks. A big obstacle for Yoconda has been the lack of financial resources. 

Her dream is to see her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed-killer, and to pay hired labor.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, quienes actualmente están estudiando, él tiene tres años de estar administrando una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, junto con su esposa atienden el negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, esta compra ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio más fuerte, ofreciendo calidad de productos, y a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, ages six and eight, who are currently going to school. He has been managing an essential goods store for three years. He tends to the business along with his wife.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase basic grains, sugar, rice, and sodas. This purchase will help him increase inventory and allow him to improve his income.

He aspires to have a stronger business offering quality products, and to provide his children with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sugar, rice, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 280 kg of beans and 100 kg of corn.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old, married and has three children.  Two are in college, and the third is in high school.  She operates a hardware shop to earn a living.  She has operated the business for four years.  She also runs a clinic, to generate more income.  Through her businesses, she has managed to provide for her family.

Jane desires to educate her three children to university level.  She believes that education is a key to a good life.  She has requested a loan of 105,300 KES to pay tuition and school fees for her three children.

loans.use: To pay college tuition and school fees for her three children

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: Ninfa is 51 years old, married and the mother of 14 children. With four children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them by buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including onions, garlic and ginger. She has been in this business for four years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including onions, garlic and ginger.

loans.name: Mimita

texts.en: Mimita is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has a small plantation where she earns a living by growing taro and bananas. She has been doing this for more than five years, and is requesting a loan to buy a shovel, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a new wheel barrow and wire. Mimita joined SPBD earlier this year and plans to use the increased income she will earn to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a new wheel barrow and wire.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Nariman prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus the photo is of her father, AbdelJaleel.  

Nariman is a Palestinian young woman. Her father is employed and her elder brother is a worker; both are getting low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs.

Nariman wants to share her family's costs in changing the living room furniture to be more comfortable, so she is requesting a USD 500 loan from FATEN to share the cost of purchasing new living room seats. Taking this loan will offer to Nariman and her family comfortable furniture so she can improve living conditions in the family's house and enjoy living in it.

loans.use: To purchase new living room seats

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 35 years old. She is married to a mechanic. They have six children aged between 10 and 18. She owns a bar and has been running a bar for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to add more beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Tatiana Maybeth

texts.es:
Tatiana Maybeth tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, vive con el conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Tatiana Maybeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 2 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. El sueño es comprarse una casa y ponerce un negocio rentable. En el tiempo libre le gusta lavar y cosinar. 
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Tatiana Maybeth is 20 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has a 3-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the Jerusalen communal bank, which is located in the El Caimito district, part of the Puerto Pechice parish in Pueblo Viejo Canton. This bank focuses on short-cycle agricultural work with members growing corn, rice and pigeon peas. Tatiana Maybeth has been doing agricultural work for 2 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and weedkiller. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy fertilizer for sowing seeds. She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. Her challenges she faces include plagues and bad weather. Her dream is to buy a house and start a profitable business. She likes to do the washing and cook in her free time. She is very grateful for previous loan because it helped her to buy what she needed for sowing and this increased her family's income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and weedkiller for farming.

loans.name: Justo Viterbo

texts.es:
JUSTO VITERBO tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

JUSTO VITERBO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar líquido, insumos, urea, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir creciendo con los cultivos.  
 
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Mocache. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es tener un carro.  En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a la familia.
texts.en:
Justo Viterbo is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives with his children and wife in the city of Ventanas in De Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Avanza Communal Bank, whose members work in agriculture.  They all live in the rural community of Aguas Frías, where most of them were raised.  The majority of them make their living in agriculture and livestock.

Justo Viterbo makes his living in agriculture, planting corn and rice, and also raising chickens and pigs.  He is applying for a loan to buy liquid, inputs, urea and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to continue increasing his crops.  The purchases will be made in the city of Mocache.  The challenges he faces are pests and bad weather.

His dream is to have a car.  In his free time, he likes to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy liquid, inputs, urea and fertilizer.

loans.name: G.s Santa Fe Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Santa Fe esta conformado por  4 integrantes, Ana, Angélica, Adelaida, Alma, todas  mayores de edad, casada, con 9 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del departamento de Chinandega municipio de Villanueva. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Angélica es la coordinadora del grupo solidario la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de grupo y de las cuotas de pago en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, fosforo, café, pan, huevos. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. El grupo solidario santa fe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Santa Fe solidarity group comprises four members: Ana, Angélica, Adelaida, and Alma. They are all adults, married, and have nine children to care for. They are originally from Villanueva, in the department of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Angélica is the coordinator for this solidarity group and she is in charge of the group's responsibilities and of how and when installment payments are made. Her business is a grocery store where she sells essential goods in small amounts, like rice, beans, sugar, milk, matches, coffee, bread, and eggs. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store so that she can cover her customers' demand. 

The Santa Fe solidarity group appreciates the help that Kiva lenders offer people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can find ways to work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, matches, coffee, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Thelma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Thelma, tiene 34 años de edad, está acompañada  de su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica  a la ganadería lechera, tiene dos vacas y un cultivo de ejotes, estas actividades son de familia, tiene 10 años en el negocio.
Su aspiración es comprarse concentrado, para el ganado lechero, esta compra le ayudara a tener una mayor producción de leche, y obtener más ganancias.
La aspiración de Thelma es fortalecer más el negocio, ya que debido a eso su condición de vida junto a su familia puede cambiar.
texts.en:
Thelma is thirty-four years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She makes a living in dairy farming.  She has two cows and a cultivation of green beans.  This is a family activity and she has been working in this business for ten years.

She hopes to buy feed for the dairy cattle.  This will help her have better milk production and thereby obtain higher profits.

Thelma's dream is to strengthen her business; in doing this, her lifestyle and that of her family can change.

loans.use: to buy feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 35-year-old woman, who is married and a mother to three sons. Her husband is a school teacher who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past three years, Lubna has been operating a school food stall, which has been a profitable project but needs more support to cover its costs. Lubna is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, to pay the rent of the food stall. This will provide consistency in her work, by enabling her to continue working effectively in the same place. That will increase her sales and improve her income, which will enable Lubna to create better living conditions for her family. Lubna's photo was taken in the place of her food stall.

loans.use: To pay the rent of the food stall

loans.name: Nipagagnon  2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les six femmes du groupe Nipagagnon 2 ont  en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Kafono dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments, de savons et des articles divers. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,   GNEFILA   (1 ère femme debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) excelle dans la vente de savons. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs   de savons (kabakourouni) et 3 sacs de savons (BT) d’une autre qualité elle s’approvisionne a Kimparana.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt,  GNEFILA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Nipagagnon 2 Group are married women who mostly live in traditional extended families. They have an average age of 39 and an average of 5 children each. They all live in the village of Kafono in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and they know one another through neighborhood ties, professional activities and kinship. They buy and sell condiments, soaps and sundries.
In order to satisfy the needs of their increasingly numerous and demanding clients, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 1st group loan.
Madame GNEFILA (1st woman standing on the photo from left to right) excels in selling soap. She is much sought after in this activity.
She plans to use this loan to buy 10 bags of traditional kabakourouni soap and 3 bags of a different quality BT soap. She gets her supplies from Kimparana. She sells for cash, retail and credit to a mixed customer base.
With this loan, GNEFILA hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA that she will use to reinvest in her business and help her husband in looking after the household needs.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Elisabeth Sourou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 42ans, Elisabeth Sourou la responsable est mariée et sans enfant. Distributrice de tissus depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de réponcre favorablement aux exigences de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer aux charges du foyer. Elisabeth Sourou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group consisting of two women who have taken out a joint loan. Elisabeth Sourou is the leader of the group. She is 42 years old, married and doesn't have any children. She has been trading in fabrics for several years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and beyond. In order to increase her capital and respond positively to the demands of her customers, she has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximize her profit and contribute to the household expenses. Elisabeth Sourou is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 25 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comite de Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo son 16 integrantes  muy trabajadoras y que están saliendo adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas.
Claudia, la presidenta, comenta que sus compañeras están muy contentas y agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben, ya que están ayudando a sus familias y a ellas mismas con esta gran oportunidad. Claudia se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases y que está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bermudas, camisillas, pantalones, camisas y demás para poder seguir vendiendo y dando buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in the city of San Lorenzo. There are 16 hardworking women who are moving forward in their businesses and in their efforts as a group.

Claudia, the group president, says that her fellow members are very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity they have received. As a result, they have been able to help their families and themselves through this wonderful opportunity. Claudia sells different types of clothing and has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy Bermuda shorts, tank tops, trousers, shirts, and other items so that she can continue selling and providing good-quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy Bermuda shorts, tank tops, trousers, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Naneu

texts.en:
Naneu is 38 years old, married to Lankisa, and supports a family of six. She is a maize farmer, and she has been in the business for the last four years. Her monthly income is KES 30,000.

She is currently seeking her second loan from KADET LTD, of KES 60,000. The loan will help her to prepare the land and get plant seedlings. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings, and to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is taking out a new loan to invest in the start of a new business, selling fish. With this new loan she plans to buy a refrigerator. 

Thanks for the previous loan, which transformed her living standards. Martha is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the support she is getting from them. She says that she wants to be punctual in repaying her loans so as to be entrusted with more loans.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her new business, selling fish.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en: Kanini is an honest, kind, and industrious woman who has the ambition of getting ahead in life. She is happy for the trust she is being given by Yehu and Kiva. She says that the previous loan helped her a lot and she is now asking for a new loan to make a new investment in her existing business. She wants to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbages, among other groceries. Kanini hopes to open a cereal shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbages, among other groceries.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 53 years old and married. She has four children. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, groceries, etc. for her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, groceries, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu (root vegetable) and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Maria hopes to improve her house and save some funds to pay for her children's education.
"

loans.use: (for example-to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals and bush knives, blades, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Angarig

texts.en:
Mrs. Angarig is a 57 year old widow who lives with her daughter, niece and nephew in small house in Dornogovi province in Mongolia. Her daughter, Oyunhishig, age 35, is an interior designer and works part-time during summers and helps her mother to run her business of a grocery store during winters. Mrs.Angarig's niece and nephew, Dashdorj and Sundariya, are secondary school students. 

Mrs. Angarig has been managing a grocery store business for years and has become popular within the area. She imports a variety of goods from China. She is a hardworking, friendly and responsible woman who says "I am planning to save the excess amounts from my business profits to help my niece and nephew with their higher education". She is requesting 1,800,000 nMNT to import a variety of food products from China to sell in her grocery store.

loans.use: to import a variety of food products from China to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is aged 36. He is married and he has six children. He sells shoes and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, Jean Claude would like to get more used shoes to sell. He plans to use the profits from the business for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Tsira, 39 years old, is from the small village of Ninotsminda district. She lives with her sons (16 and 21 years old). Tsira is involved in agricultural activities. She has milk cows and sells milk locally at an open market at a good price. She is a very hard working woman and has rich experience in her business. 

Tsira plans to repair her cattle-shed and purchase an additional milking cow. She plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed doesn’t allow her to implement her plan. Once her cattle-shed is larger, Tsira will expand her animal husbandry business and the family’s income, from the sale of dairy products, will increase. She will reinvest her additional earnings to expand her agricultural enterprise and make it more profitable. Tsira awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow and to repair the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Mwatela

texts.en: Mwatela is 38 years old and lives with his wife and five children, all of whom attend school. His oldest child helps him run his business over the weekends. Mwatela sells livestock for slaughter. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years and is quite successful in his business. He wants to increase the quantity of his livestock and develop his business. Mwatela wants to obtain a loan of the amount of 20,000 KES to buy five goats to resell.

loans.use: to buy five goats to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a machine for cement

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en: Garneth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a videoke (entertainment) rental business in the Philippines for 15 years. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase an additional videoke unit. Garneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional videoke (entertainment) unit.

loans.name: Filadelfia Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, este es el Grupo “Filadelfia” que conforman 09 socios que se dedican a distintas actividades comerciales. En esta oportunidad conocerán a Norma. Ella tiene 45 años, casada y tiene 6 hijos de las cuales 03 de ellos en etapa escolar. Norma tiene una imprenta la cual lleva trabajando junto a su esposo hace más de 23 años. Norma se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su trabajo a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación .El mayor anhelo de Norma es de seguir creciendo en su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales. Su crédito actual lo destinara para la compra de almanaques, materiales para tarjetas y tintas. Gracias al préstamo que le brinda Kiva puede seguir mejorando su negocio. Norma se encuentra sentada al lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
Hello from Peru!  This is the group "Filadelfia" that is made up of nine members that make a living in different commercial activities.  Norma is the borrower featured in this opportunity.

Norma is forty-five years old, is married, and has six children, three of which are in school.  Norma has a printing service where she has been working alongside her husband for more than twenty-three years.  Norma feels proud.  Thanks to her job, she has been able to support her children in their education.

Norma's greatest desire is to continue growing her business and to see her children become professionals.  With this loan, she will buy calendars, materials for cards, and ink.  Thanks to the loan that Kiva offers her, she can continue to improve her business.

Norma is seated on the left-hand side in a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy calendars, materials for cards, and ink.

loans.name: Riadh

texts.en: Riadh is a 38-year-old married man and has children, who are still in school. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He lives in rented house. He has applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB to buy fridge for his home. He would like to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for his home.

loans.name: Labib

texts.en:
Labib is 31 years old. He runs a small store where he sells grocery items to the people in his area. From this, he earns a small amount which is not enough for his family's sustenance. He is a married man and has one child who lives in Aden, Yemen. He aims to increase his profits, but had inadequate funds to invest in his business. 

Now he is asking for a loan of 150,000 YER. This will be used to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store.  He hopes to have a car to facilitate carrying his goods to his store from the market.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap for his business

loans.name: Raimatou

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans, Raimatou mariée et sans enfant. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la distribution des mèches et des bijoux depuis 03ans puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en: Raimatou is a 31 year old married woman who doesn't have any children. She has been specializing in the trading of hair extensions and jewels for 03 years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets outside Benin. In order to strengthen her purchasing power and to meet the needs of her customers, she has requested and received a loan from the microfinance institution Finadev so that she can maximize her business and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy10 dozen hair extensions and 20 sets of jewellery

loans.name: Anich Yabo

texts.fr: Agée de 39ans, Anich Yabo est mariée et mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 20ans et 10ans. Elle a une boutique sise au cœur de la ville où elle vend des chaussures et des sacs depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Anich Yabo is 39 years old, married and mother to 4 children who are in school. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 10. She has a store located in the heart of the city where she has been selling shoes and bags for several years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets in Benin and also outside Benin. In order to increase her turnover and satisfy the considerable demand of her ever-increasing customers, she has requested a loan from the microfinance institution Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximize her profit and contribute to the education costs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes and 50 bags

loans.name: Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 37ans, Elisabeth la responsable est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 16ans puis scolarisé dans un établissement de la place. Spécialisée dans la vente des boîtes de conserve, des pâtes alimentaires, de liqueurs et d'autres articles depuis 03ans, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'agrandir son commerce et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le surplus dégagé par ce crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et d'acheter une parcelle. Elisabeth se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This group consists of two women with joint liability. Elisabeth is the leader of the group. She is 37 years old, married and mother to a 16 year old child who is enrolled in a local school. Elisabeth has been specializing in the sale of canned foods, pasta, liqueur and other items for 03 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to expand her business and to cater to the needs of her customers, she has requested and obtained a microloan from the microfinance institution Finadev. The surplus generated by this loan will enable her to contribute to the education costs of her child and to buy a plot of land. Elisabeth is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 1 carton of milk, 1 carton of sardines, 1 carton of pasta and 5 cartons of liqueur

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
Compra de productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, harina, manteca, detergente, medicamentos, refrescos y condimentos.
La señora María tiene 53 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo, reside con su familia en una comunidad del municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Doña María inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 5 años, ella vende productos alimenticios para satisfacer la canasta básica familiar. Ella se vio motivada a  establecer su negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios: arroz, azúcar, harina, manteca, detergente, medicamentos, refrescos y condimentos, papel higiénico y golosinas.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a mantener surtido su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 53 years old. She and her husband are in a common-law relationship and they have one child. María and her family reside in a community in the town of Morazán, Department of Yoro.

Doña María started her grocery business five years ago. She sells food products used in preparing family meals. María was motivated to establish her business so that she could help her husband with the family expenses.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 HNL. María plans to invest the money in the purchase of food products such as rice, sugar, flour, and lard, as well as detergents, medicines, soft drinks, condiments, toilet paper, and snacks.

She believes the loan will be helpful because it will help her to maintain the inventory in her business and allow her to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, lard, detergents, medicines, soft drinks, condiments, toilet paper, and snacks.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional stock of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of biscuits and dried fish. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia hopes to be able to develop her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Fonoki

texts.en:
Fonoki is a 33 year old woman who is married and hase 1 child. She runs a business sewing and designing clothing in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Fonoti has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, materials, threads and needles. She plans to use her profits to expand her business in the future and to help support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, materials, threads and needles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Cecilla

texts.en:
Cecilla is 50 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her four children.

Cecilla runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. Cecilla has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Cecilla would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia, 56, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Inocencio, an employee, and she is a mother. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Ofelia is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ofelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Ofelia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Ofelia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ofelia hopes to expand her business through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a fifty-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been running a small sari-sari store, or variety store, for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Bebiana is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of goods to sell in her store such as detergents, toiletries and seasonings. In the future, Bebiana hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to explore other ventures to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell in her store, such as detergents, toiletries and seasonings.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi, 39, lives with her life partner and their five children. She is very responsible and wants her children to have a good, stable life, so she works to help her husband. Umazi runs a snack shop – a store where she makes and sells chips (fried potatoes) and fried eggs. She runs it from her home and makes the typical dish every day of the week, taking advantage of the weekends when she sells the most. She is requesting a loan to buy all the necessary basic ingredients, like raw potatoes, cooking oil, and trays of eggs.

loans.use: to buy all the basic ingredients for making a typical Kenyan dish, fried eggs and chips, to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 56 years old and married. She has six children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Juanita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF, to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 17 years. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Marieta

texts.en:
This is Maria Marieta. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan, which she used buy larger quantities of products like fish balls, hot dogs, fruits and other street food staples. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan, to purchase more quantities of products like fish balls, hot dogs, fruits and other street food staples, to sell in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria Marieta dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education, through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for larger quantities of products like fish balls, hot dogs, fruits and other street food staples, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new floormats for his taxi.

loans.name: Good Starter Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah has a drug shop and does farming to supplement the meager income from the drug sales. She started this business to sustain her family. She wants the money to buy more drugs for the shop. 

It's been the rainy season and usually more people are prone to diseases during such seasons. It's also approaching festive season where there are many disease outbreaks because of celebrations. So when she has enough stock, she will be able to meet her customers' needs and also make more profits. Her clients are mainly community members. 

Her hopes for the future are to expand the drug shop and maybe get outlets. Her major challenge is taking drugs on credit. She is hard-working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy drugs for her shop

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 18 to 26. Two of them are in school and live at home, while the oldest ones live on their own. 

For the past 20 years she has been selling frozen fish, chicken, pigs' feet, and chicken feet in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business, and she learned this way of selling from her mother.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more products for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen fish, chicken, pigs' feet, and chicken feet for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Maria Elena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear.

Maria Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother three from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in crab fishing for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Delia wants to get a loan to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish and crabs to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Al Wafaa Group

texts.en:
Wafaa is the featured borrower of Al Wafaa Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is the one on the left.

Wafaa has been selling accessories for 12 years and does well in her business because she is a widow and had to take on the full responsibility of raising her four children after her husband passed away. Wafaa is a 57-year-old hard worker, well known in the region for her good quality products and special prices. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital with new released accessories for the coming Christmas season. She will also start selling bed sheets and blankets as an additional income source, especially before the coming winter season, to cover almost all of her family's needs. 

Farida is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been working in recycling cardboard for seven years. She is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a special plastic grinder as an additional income business to help her husband in making their living. She is also an employee at a school in the morning. In the afternoons, she manages her own business. She is the first one from the right. 

Elham is a 52-year-old married woman who has been working in decorating and selling artificial flowers for 15 years. She is requesting this loan to buy special Christmas artificial flowers to prepare for the coming Holly season. She is the second one from the left.

Hanan is a 52-year-old married woman who has been working as a tailor for 10 years. She is the mother of five children and puts so much effort into helping her husband to make a living and cover their expenses. She is applying for a loan, from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new tailoring machine that will help her a lot in producing better quality tailoring work.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with new released accessories for the coming Christmas season.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a person who enjoys her work. She is very responsible in her activities. She lives with her five children in Samburu, Coast Province.

Nadzua works buying and selling charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for five years.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of charcoal to sell. This investment will allow her to increase her production, sales and income, which will help her to improve her children's quality of life.

Nadzua's dream is to expand her market so that she can distribute her charcoal to other places.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. Rosevilla has been in this business for 14 years. She earns addition income from buying and selling bananas.
