Rosevilla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business .

loans.name: Paulyne

texts.en:
Paulyne is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children that she supports. She has been running a retail shop for the last three years, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g maize flour, fresh milk, crates of bread to sell.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to add on consumable goods to her retail shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old. She is married to a motorist. They have three children. The children all go to schools. 

Florence sells vegetables. With the loan, she wants to buy vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 44 year old man and a father of 4 children. The children’s ages are between 22 and 15 years old and they are all attending school. Moses has been involved in Tofu and “Tempe” (which is made of fermented soy bean) production for 8 years. Moses’ family also assists him in running the business so Moses does not need to employ any workers. 

Moses usually distributes his products directly to the customers and to sellers in the market. Recently, Moses dreams of initiating a poultry business. He believes that the business has a good prospect in the future. This is why he is requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He wants to utilize the loan to buy 5 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vitamins, vaccines, etc.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vitamins, vaccines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Lourd Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourd Jane works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lourd Jane is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lourd Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Manuel Benjamin

texts.es: Manuel de 62 años de edad, vive en el corregimiento de Salgar- balneario del municipio de Puerto Colombia, a orillas del Mar Caribe. Allí al ritmo de la música, las olas del mar y el sol y la brisa, tiene una tienda donde vende refrescos y bebidas,   ranchos y víveres, en pequeñas cantidades de acuerdo a las posibilidades de compras diarias, de su clientela. Manuel tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio, el cual  inició cuando era conductor de buses intermunicipales y decidió crear un negocio, para que su esposa generara otros ingresos, mientras atendía las labores del hogar simultáneamente. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, con una frecuencia diaria desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, mientras sus compras las realiza en un 90% de contado, en depósitos mayoristas de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 25 minutos del corregimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará arroz, aceites, granos, detergentes, víveres, frutas carnes refrescos y lácteos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos. Su meta más adelante es ampliar el negocio hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio y finalmente construir una segunda planta, que diferencie su espacio comercial del familiar y lograr total sosiego.
texts.en:
Manuel is 62 years old and lives in the district of Salgar, a seaside resort in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, on the Caribbean coast. Among the music, the waves, the sun, and the breeze, he has a store where he sells sodas and drinks, canned food, and groceries in small amounts, in keeping with his customers' daily shopping possibilities. 

Manuel has five years of experience in his business. He started it back when he was a regional bus driver and decided to start a business so that his wife could generate another income while taking care of the home at the same time. He makes sales for cash and on credit, and his daily schedule is from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM. He makes 90% of his purchases on credit, buying from wholesale warehouses in the city of Barranquilla, 25 minutes away. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy rice, oil, grains, detergent, groceries, fruit, meat, soft drinks, and dairy products in larger amounts so that he can get discount prices. His goal for the future is to expand his business until it becomes a self-service store and eventually build a second floor to separate his living space from his business in order to obtain peace and quiet.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, grains, detergent, groceries, fruit, meat, soft drinks, and dairy products.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en: Astghik lives in Yerevan with her 17-year-old daugher Julieta. Astghik works at one of the military units of the Ministry of Defence as a hairdresser. Her daugher is a student at Yerevan State Medical College and wants to become a nurse. Astghik's current salary doesn't allow her to save for Julieta's education so she has applied for this loan of AMD 19,0000 to pay her annual tuition fee. Julieta dreams of working and helping her mother with the household. This loan is important for her to continue her education and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is 22-year-old student from Yerevan. She is taking her Master's Degree at Yerevan State University in the faculty of philology. She is in her second course. Ani has applied for this loan in order to pay her tuition fee for the first semester. Ani lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and brother-in-law. This loan is important for the family to be financially stable and be able to cover their costs.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira  est secrétaire du groupe Jipe Moyo. Elle est jeune entrepreneur âgée de 23 et mère de 4 enfants. Son conjoint est un chauffeur taxi man. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle fait  aussi la broderie et la tricoteuse et parfois elle réalise le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle commença avec le crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans ce programme. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter une machine tricoteuse. Actuellement, son défi majeur est la mévente. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kavira is the secretary of the Jipe Moyo group. She is a young entrepreneur, aged 23 and she is the mother of four children. Her partner is a taxi driver, and she sells second-hand clothing. She also does embroidery and knitting, and occasionally sells foodstuffs as well.
She began with the basic credit program from Hekima (a micro-finance institution "MFI"). She has just completed two loan cycles with this program. 
She will use this new loan to buy a knitting machine. Currently, her biggest problem is the economic crisis. 
She thanks Hekima for its efforts targeting unbanked female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a knitting machine.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds, and 75 kgs of chemical fertiliser.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident  toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jeanne est âgée de 31 ans,et est mariée à un certain Paul. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté. Le couple a quatre enfants,dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jeanne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de seize ans que Jeanne vend divers produits et des céréales(maïs et farine de manioc) à son domicile. Jeanne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: DIEU EST GRAND is a group of three people, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group leader, Jeanne, is 31 years old and married to a Paul. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school, and all for whom they are responsible. Jeanne and her husband live together with their children and assume different responsibilities in their home. For almost 16 years, Jeanne has been selling from home miscellaneous products and grains (corn and cassava root flour). Jeanne runs this business with passion, which allows her to meet the needs of her children and herself. Jeanne stocks up at the market in Bénin. In the quest to satisfy her clientele, Jeanne is seeking with the other members of the DIEU EST GRAND group, her first loan with ALIDé. This loan will help her better meet the needs of her clientele and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products and grains (corn and cassava root flour)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer (32 kilos) and pay labour costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer (150 kilos) and seed

loans.name: Vyose N'imana Group

texts.fr:
A. Marie fait partie du groupe Vyose n’Imana et habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 26 ans. Elle a un enfant de 5 ans. Elle vit avec ses parents. 

Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc sec, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter sa propre parcelle,et voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en:
A. Marie is a part of the Vyose n’Imana group and lives in Bujumbura. He is single and 26 years old. She has a 5-year-old child. She lives with her parents.

She has been selling dry cassava root for 5 years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she is getting, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of dry cassava root to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy her own plot of land and send her child to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of dry cassava root to resell and earn more

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is 43 years old. She is married to a house builder. They have three children who all go to school. Anastasie sells foodstuffs and has been in that business for twenty years. She wants to use the loan to buy more potatoes, beans and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used as savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Solaiman

texts.en:
Solaiman is aged 30 years and is married to Novi, 28. They have a daughter named Asumi, 3 years old. To make a living, Solaiman runs a kiosk business selling daily basic needs such as: mobile phone recharges, soap, cigarettes, cold drinks, snacks, etc. The income generated from the business is spent to cover the family’s living expenditures.

Solaiman realizes that the income he generates is often insufficient. This situation led him to initiate another business which is a poultry business. He is sure that this business will enable him to gain extra income. This thought drove him to apply for a loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. This loan will be utilized to buy 10 new mobile phones to be resold at his kiosk. Solaiman is hoping that he can gain success in his business.

loans.use: to buy 10 new mobile phones to be resold at his kiosk.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Douglas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as an obedient and humble man. He operates a repair store business where he repairs electronics. His business is located within a busy environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 15600 loan to purchase a water tank that will be used by his four family members. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy more water tanks that will store clean water to sell to the community. Douglas has previously taken a loan of KES 20,000 which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is now 68 years old, still living happily with his family, and his four children are above 18 years old. Simon is still doing his masonry work and has been in operation for the last 25 years. 

He is now servicing his ninth loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD, after he repaid the previous one successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase raw materials to enable him to build more rental houses.  

The profits achieved will be used to improve the living standards of his family. He hopes for a better living and to own more plots and develop new rentals.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and seven children. She sells charcoal at the market. She’s a very enterprising woman who works hard to help cover household expenses and earn a little money to cover some needs. She’s struggled to keep her business afloat because competition is always there. She’s been in business for many years so has many regular customers who prefer her more every day since she’s a very charismatic, honest working woman.

She’s decided to ask Yehu for a loan because she wants to invest in her business buying more sacks of charcoal that will allow her to keep her business well-stocked. This will lead to improved profits that will give her the opportunity of attaining a better quality of life. She states that she’s very grateful to this institution because it provided her with help in the past when she most needed it. She hopes to have favorable results this time too.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to restock her business

loans.name: Gilsom

texts.en:
Gilsom is a 30 year old married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is buying and selling locally made alcohol from bananas. He also deals in produce like beans and maize. He started the business after accessing its lucrative nature and ready market. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and renovate his semi-permanent house.

His major challenges are inadequate capital to meet the high demand and price fluctuations. His dream is to process it so as to add value and increase on the profits. Gilsom intends to use the loan to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Marie Florence

texts.en: Marie Florence is 33 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have been blessed with two children. She sells various items in her store. She has been in that business for four years. With the loan, she wants to add more kilograms of sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and many other items for sale. With the profits from the business, she plans to build a house one day.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to resell in her store.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 38-year-old woman; she is married and a mother to four sons and one daughter. Her husband is a laborer and gets a low wage, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past five years, Mayson has been working in a sewing workshop, sewing clothes for customers. She earns a low wage, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Therefore, Mayson is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new sewing machine. She will use the new machine to work at home in the afternoons, to provide better quality to her loyal customers. This will increase her sales and improve Mayson's income.

Mayson is photographed in the sewing workshop where she works.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 25 years old. She is married to a barber. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past five years. She would like to get a loan to improve her business through adding more tones of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 32 years old. She is a single lady and a mother of two children aged twelve and four. She is a mixed crop farmer in Narok and has been farming for the last seven years. Her monthly income is KES 30,000.

This is her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. which she intends to use to buy farm inputs for better crop yields and also land preparation.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. Her future dreams is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lidia Angela

texts.es: Lilia está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, telas, hilos e insumos para fabricar los uniformes que le encargó un colegio de Puerto Colombia; Porque con su credikiva anterior logró adquirir una máquina de coser y materias primas como telas, botones, encajes y accesorios y su calidad en los tiempos y el acabado aumentó. Hoy se siente muy feliz y dice a sus financiadores “ Deseo que tengan una navidad en paz y amor al lado de sus seres queridos y siempre la bondad del altísimo los acompañe por hacerle tanto bien a los microempresarios del mundo entero. “
texts.en: Lilia is applying a new kiva credit with which she will buy in bulk fabric, thread and supplies to manufacture uniforms ordered by the school of Puerto Colombia. Because with her prior kiva credit she was able to acquire a sewing machine and raw materials like fabic, buttons, laces and accessories, her quality and completion times improved. Today she feels very happy and tell her financiers "She hopes you have a Christmas full of peace and love at the side of your loved ones, and the goodness of the Almighty be with you for making so much good for microentrepreneurs worldwide."

loans.use: to buy in bulk fabrics, thread and supplies to manufacture uniforms.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro Antonio tiene 23 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

Pedro Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir creciendo con los cultivos.   
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es combatir las plagas. 
El sueño es tener casa propia.  En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio is 23 years old. He is single and has a child. He lives with the mother in the town of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

He belongs to the solidarity group Avanza, whose members are all farmers residing in Agua Frías. They have virtually grown up in the area and mostly work in agriculture or raising animals. 

Pedro Antonio is a farmer. He grows corn and also raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, urea, liquid weed-killer, and fertilizer. This loan will allow him to keep expanding his crops.

He will make his purchases in the town of Ventanas. The challenge he faces is fighting pests. His dream is to have his own home. In his free time he enjoys taking care of the crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies, urea, liquid weed-killer, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alexis Fabian

texts.es:
ALEXIS FABIAN tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con un hermano en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

ALEXIS FABIAN  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas que tanta falta le hace.

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Zapotal. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es ser más responsable en el trabajo.

El sueño es tener un Agroservicio propio.  En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota y cuidar los cultivos.
texts.en:
Alexis Fabian is 22 years old and sigle. He doesn't have children. He lives with his brother in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

He belongs to the solidarity group Alianza, whose members are all farmers residing in Agua Frías. They have virtually grown up in the area and work mostly in agriculture or raising animals.

Alexis Fabian is a farmer. He grows corn and also raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, supplies, urea, and fertilizer. This loan will allow him to buy the farming supplies he so badly needs.  

He will make his purchases in the town of Ventanas Zapotal. The challenge he faces is becoming a more responsible worker. 

His dream is to have his own agricultural service center.  In his free time he enjoys playing ball and taking care of the crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, urea, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yovani

texts.es: Yovani, tiene 31 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de la Unión Lempira. Yovani, ha realizado actividades agrícolas desde muy joven junto con sus padres. Hace 12 años que comenzó a realizar sus propios cultivos de maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona siendo su fuente de ingresos familiar. El ha obtenido dos préstamos en ODEF para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Ahora solicito un tercer préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar, fertilizante,abono y pago de mano de obra para asistencia al cultivo de frijol y de maíz, con el fin de obtener mejores cosechas y mejorar sus ingresos ya que su esfuerzo es para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Yovani, age 31, is married and has three children.  He lives in a village in the Unión municipality in Lempira.  He has been working in agriculture since he was very young and  worked with his parents.

Twelve years ago he started his own corn and bean crops.  He sells this production at the local market in the area.  This is his source of family income.

He has received two loans from ODEF in order to provide maintenance to his crops.  He is now requesting his third loan for 10,000 lempiras.  He will buy natural and chemical fertilizer, and he will pay for the labor to help with his bean and corn crops.  He will do this in order to get better harvests and to improve his income.  The effort he makes is so that he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizer, and to pay for the labor to help with his bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Antonia es madre soltera, tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad es estudiar, tiene 1 hijos el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la confección de playeras, trabajo que inicio siendo operaria, y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas para la confección de mas producción, como lo es tela, hilos de varios clores, ya que espera seguir produciendo mas, espera en el futuro con una maquila, y facilitar empleo para otras personas.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia, 52, is a single mother.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has one child who is currently in school.  She started as a worker making shirts, and now has 15 years of experience.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more tread of different colors to increase her production.  In the future, she hopes to have an assembly plant and to be able to employ other people.

loans.use: Comprar telas para playeras

loans.name: Deyédjrodo Gérardine's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 49ans, Deyédjrodo Gérardine la responsable est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé 36ans et le moins âgé 15ans. Elle vend des beignets et des ignames frits depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. L'intérêt dégagé de ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Deyédjrodo Gérardine se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two women acting as mutual guarantors. 49 years old, Deyédjrodo Gérardine is the supervisor - she is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are in school. The eldest is 36 and the youngest 15 years old. She has sold donuts and fried yams for several years, and buys her provisions in one of Bénin's markets.  Experienced in business, she has sought financing from Finadev in order to increase her purchasing power and thus meet customer demand. The delayed interest payments on this loan will allow her to help with the children's school fees, and to meet their needs. Deyédjrodo Gérardine is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of yams and five kilograms of beans.

loans.name: Fenou Group

texts.fr: FENOU est un groupement de onze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Françoise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Françoise est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Françoise a un peu fréquenté.le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Françoise vend des cossettes d’ignames et des ignames à son domicile. Françoise s’approvisionne un marché et dans une région du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Françoise et les autres membres du groupement FENOU sollicitent pour une troisième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FENOU is a group of eleven people, whose members live in the same area. The group representative, Françoise has her hand raised in the photo. She is 51 and is married to a man named Joseph. Françoise did not attend much school. The couple have three children, all attend school and live with them at home. The couple live together with their children, and they meet the household budget together. To do so, she sells yam chips and yams from her home.
She buys her provisions in a market in a region of Bénin. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.  Françoise and the other members of FENOU are seeking ALIDé's financial assistance for the third time, in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses, and to better meet their customers' requirements. The previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Julio Elias

texts.es:
El señor Julio Elias  esta casado, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la tejeduría inicio este trabajo trabajando con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa qui realiza el mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y poder tejerlos con el estilo mariposa, espera en el futuro contar con empleados y mejorar sus ingreso.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Elias is married, 21 years old and completed three years of primary school.  He has one child and makes his living knitting.  He started his business by working with his parents, and now has five years of experience.  He has the support of his wife, who does the same work. 

Señor Julio Elias is requesting a loan, which will be used to purchase different colored yarn to knit in a butterfly style.  He hopes to, in the future, have more employees and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Germán Santos

texts.es:
El señor German Santos es casado, tiene 29 años de edad, es perito contador, tiene un hijo pequeño, se dedica a prestar servicios profesionales para una empresa, asistente administrativo, ha recibido un ascenso, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a impartir clases, tiene 5 años de experiencia en su trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para cubrir gastos de su familia, que ha invitado, para celebrar la graduación de su hermana específicamente, espera mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, y poder tener un mejor empleo también.
texts.en:
German Santos is 29 years old. He is married and has a young son. He is an qualified accountant and provides professional services to a company. He is an administrative assistant and has been promoted. 
His wife helps him; she takes care of the household and gives classes. She has been working for 5 years.

He is requesting a loan to cover family expenses, and to have a party to celebrate the graduation of his sister. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family, and to have a better job in the future.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Burkina Group

texts.fr:
Mme AUDREY VALERIE SINDA est responsable du  groupe BURKINA. Sophie se porte bien mais a décidé de céder sa place à Audrey.  Mariée, elle est mère d’un (01) enfant. Ce dernier à deux(02) ans. Elle a une (01) personne en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes tissés et du charbon depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les revendeurs du marché et ses voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter  01 balle de fil à tissé et deux sacs de charbon.
Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne confectionner des machines à tisser et employer des femmes et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. AUDREY VALERIE SINDA is the leader of the BURKINA group. Sophie is doing well but decided to cede her position to Audrey. Married, she is a mother of one child, who is 2. She takes care of one person. Mrs. Audrey has been selling weaved pagnes (traditional wraps) and charcoal for 5 years. She stocks up at her neighborhood market. Her clients are resellers at the market and her neighbors. She wants to buy one ball of weaving yarn and two sacks of charcoal. She saves her profits. Mrs. Audrey plans to make weaving machines, employ women, and help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy one ball of weaving yarn and two sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Medalla milagrosa es de la ciudad de Encarnación, gracias a que las miembros trabajan juntas y se ayudan, ya están en su octavo ciclo y miran para adelante diciendo que seguirán hasta el máximo nivel.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ignacia, ella se dedica  a la venta de manualidades y repostería. Y cuenta que solicita este crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de masas dulces y panificados,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a la oportunidad que recibe podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las demás miembros están muy contentas también, ya que van creciendo y las capacitaciones les son de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) is in the city of Encarnación. Thanks to its members who have worked together and helped one another, they have reached their eighth loan cycle. They say that they look forward to continuing on toward the highest level.

One of the group members is Sra. Ignacia, who sells handicrafts and baked goods. She says that she is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for making pastries and breads. Ignacia says that she is very grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her family’s income.

The rest of the members are very pleased as well. They want to continue growing and the training classes have been a great help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making pastries and breads.

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr:
Amida fait partie du groupe Ukweli  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et mariée à Kitete, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 15 ans,tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  matériels de couture depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de matériels de couture (fil, doublure, polyester,…), à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  construire sa propre maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Amida is a part of the Ukweli  group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 and married to Kitete, a civil servant. They have five children together, between the ages of 5 and 15, all of whom attend school.

She has been selling sewing materials for 10 years.

She is on her twelfth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is receiving, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of sewing materials (string, lining, polyester, etc.) to resell to earn a profit.

In the coming years, she would like to build her own house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of sewing materials (string, lining, polyester, etc.) to resell to earn a profit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to resell to earn a profit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Chakadola Self Help Group

texts.en: Chakadola Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years ago, they all were facing poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of the members is Mrs Susila who was selected as their president. Susila is a 34-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children who are attending school. The lady in the blue sari sitting fifth from the left is Susila. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en: Ariunbold is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in small house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Bayarhuu, age 30, just gave birth to their youngest son and is taking care of their children. His other children are: Temuulen, 8 years old, goes to primary school, and Telmuun and Temuugen, male and female twins, 3 years old, go to kindergarten. He has been providing taxi services since 2008 with his Hyundai. He is planning to change his car to an eco-friendly electric and gas hybrid car to reduce fuel consumption and increase efficiency of his business. He is now requesting to 2,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly gas and electric hybrid car. He is an optimistic, hardworking and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly gas and electric hybrid car to provide taxi services

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Amalia is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jojeta

texts.en:
Jojeta is a 49-year-old, married woman, and a mother of two children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business, since her husband is a fisherman. She also sells home-cooked foods to the people in her neighborhood.

Jojeta is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and fish hooks, as well as ingredients for her food vending business, like sugar and glutinous rice.

Jojeta hopes to expand her businesses in the future, so that they will continue to generate revenue for her needs, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, and ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man, who has been working as a guard since June 2004. In September 2012, he found an extra income job to improve his living conditions, because as a Palestinian, job vacancies and varieties are limited. He found this chance and couldn't refuse it, because he believes that he will work hard to learn how to be skilled in furniture-making and he might start his own business as soon as he finds himself skilled enough to take full responsibility for his own business. In addition, he wants to savie the necessary capital to start his own business.

Mohamad is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay the remaining amount of the cost of his car so that he can move easily between both jobs, and be ready to reply to any future extra income furniture maintenance request.

This is Mohamad's second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. He has a good history of paying back. He believes that his previous loan reflected positively on his social life and helped him a lot in his financial situation.

He hopes to keep on improving his living as much as he can.

loans.use: To pay the remaining part of the cost of his car.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children who she supports. She has been running a tailoring shop for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES  20,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to add to her dress making fabrics.

The anticipated profits will be reinvested in the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for dress making

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en: Mr Bayarbat is 30 years old and lives with his mother, wife and his son in his mother's apartment in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Bolormaa, 28, studies at the state medical university. His son Tuvshintugs, 3, stays home with the borrower's mother. Mr Bayarbat has been working as an interior designer at a private company for seven years. He is planning to buy an eco-friendly electric and gas car for his family's use. So he is requesting 3,400,000 MNT to purchase the car He is a welcoming, friendly and responsible person who says, "I want to decrease air pollution and this is my contribution to decrease air pollution to my city".

loans.use: to purchase an cco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for his family's use

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 26 years old. She is married to a motorbike rider. She sells womean's clothes and has been in that business for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more women's clothes in different styles to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house for her residence.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store business. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell to customers.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Olivia  P.

texts.en: Olivia is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children ages 5 to 23. Two are in school and all of them live at home. For the past twenty-one years she has been selling palm oil, rice, and pepper in the local market. She make a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and rice and fresh peppers, and she has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, and peppers for her business. She hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, and pepper for her business,

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en: Gaudance, a mother of one child who is attending school, is married to a house builder. Gaudance has been selling vegetables for five years, and will use this loan to purchase more vegetables such as carrots, eggplant and tomatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the paperwork and processing expenses for his professional degree

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
La señora María Felicita  tiene  70 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar en el oeste de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
El esposo de la señora María Felicita  trabajó por unos años en el corte de caña, posteriormente  falleció hace 5 años.
 Además de ella tener infección renal crónica diagnosticada tiene una lesión en la rodilla de la pierna izquierda que le impide hacer compras  así que se apoya con sus  hijas 

El sustento de la familia es que una mini pulpería con la cual mantiene sus gastos médicos ya que lo que le dan en una pensión que recibe no cubre gastos médicos.

El destino del crédito es  para la compra de inventario para su  pequeño negocio.

La señora María Felicita  manifestó que el fondo anterior lo ha utilizado en su pulperia, además ha podido apoyar a sus hijas.  
Agradece a CEPRODEL  y Kiva que de esta manera está mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Felicita is 70 years old.  She lives in the municipality of Chichigalpa, a place located in the west of Nicaragua know for its sugar cane and liquor production.  It is one of the warmest places of Nicaragua.

Maria Felicita's husband worked for many years cutting sugar cane, he passed away 5 years ago.
In addition to having chronic renal insufficiency, she has a left knee injury that stops her from doing her own purchases so she relies on her daughters for this.  The family income is a small convenience store with which she covers her medical expenses because the pension income she receives is not sufficient.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her small business.  Maria Felicita mentions that the previous loan was also used in the store and she has been able to support her daughters.  She is thankful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for letting her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store, such as candy, popsicles etc.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene la edad de 49 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos ya son independientes. Ella es Licenciada en ciencias naturales y labora como directora de un centro escolar público desde hace 27 años.
Es una persona emprendedora y con deseos de superación, además se dedica al comercio, ya que cuenta con un negocio ambulante desde hace varios años.
Los créditos otorgados han sido de gran ayuda porque le han permitido hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación y de esta forma le mejoran sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old, married, and has four children, who are all independent now. She has a degree in natural sciences and has been working as principal of a public school for 27 years. 

She is enterprising person with the desire to improve herself, and is also a businessperson, as she has had a business selling door-to-door for several years. 

The loans granted have been a great help because they have allowed her to do home improvements, and this way improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To pay for labor for home improvements

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
Matagalpa la perla del septentrión una linda e importante ciudad por su alta producción de café ubicada en el norte de Nicaragua es originario José Alberto, casado y tiene tres hijos varones todo ellos en edad escolar.

José Alberto se caracteriza por ser una persona de respeto, responsable con sus obligaciones y muy trabajador, actualmente trabaja para una  empresa como albañil, con sus sueldo que devenga de este empresa lo destina para la compra de canasta básica y algunos gasto en el hogar, tiene el deseo y la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda pero el salario no es suficiente para cubrir este gasto es por tal razón que el crédito que se le desembolso lo tiene destinado para la compra de arena y cemento ya que va a repellar toda su casa.

Me siento alegre y agradecido con este crédito de ceprodel y kiva me está apoyando manifestó don José ya que es la manera que va poder realizarle las mejora
texts.en:
Matagalpa, the pearl of the north, is a beautiful city located in the north of Nicaragua that is important for its large coffee production.  José Alberto is a native of Matagalpa.  He is married and has three school-aged sons.

José Alberto is known as being a respectful person who is responsible with regard to his obligations and a very hard worker.  He currently works for a company as a brick layer.  His income from the company is used for basic grocery needs and some household expenses.  He wants and needs to make improvements to his house, but his salary isn't enough to cover the costs.  And that is the reason he is taking out the loan.  He plans to use it to purchase sand and cement to plaster his entire house.  

"I am happy with and grateful for this loan from Ceprodel and Kiva.  It is helping me," don José expressed.  It will enable him to carry out the improvements.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to plaster his house.

loans.name: Jamilet

texts.es:
Jamilet es una mujer emprendedora, labora como maestra de educación primaria, también tiene su propio negocio en su casa una tienda de Ropa y Calzado de diferentes tallas y estilos, solicita un financiamiento a ceprodel para incrementar el inventario de su tienda y lograr la oportunidad de negocio en estas fechas de navidad, el que lo utilizaría en la compra de Bóxer de damas, caballeros, bikines de dama, sandalias planas, plataforma, tacón fino, variedades Pons, estuche grande y pintura de uña.
 De esta manera aprovechar las vacaciones escolares para dedicarle tiempo completo al negocio, ya que fortalece la economía del hogar por lo que su salario no le permite tener mejores condiciones de vida, si no a través de otros esfuerzos en las actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Yamileth is an enterprising woman. She works as an elementary school teacher and also owns her own business. She sells clothing and shoes of various sizes and styles at her home. She requests a loan from Ceprodel so that she can stock up her business and take advantage of the sales opportunities during this holiday season. She'll use the loan in order to purchase men's and women's boxer shorts, women's bathing suits, flat sandals, platform shoes, high heeled shoes, large makeup sets and nail polish.
That way she'll take advantage of the school vacation and work on her business full time, because it strengthens her household financial situation. Her salary doesn't allow her to improve her living conditions, and she does this through the other efforts she puts into her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's boxer shorts, women's bathing suits, flat sandals, platform shoes, high heeled shoes, large makeup sets and nail polish.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ENAGNON est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sylvie Megnissè, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sylvie Megnissè est âgée de 33 ans et est  marié à Evariste, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sylvie Megnissè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les diverses charges du ménage. Sylvie Megnissè a peu fréquenté. Il y a près de douze ans que Sylvie Megnissè exerce comme activité, la vente des produits cosmétiques et des mèches à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sylvie Megnissè désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Sylvie Megnissè sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ENAGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON group has eleven members, who all live in the same area. The group representative, named Sylvie Megnissè, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 33 years old and is married to Evariste - a driver. They have three children, all in school and dependent on them. Sylvie Megnissè lives together with her husband and her children.  The couple share the different household costs. Sylvie Megnissè did not go to school very much. 
She has been selling cosmetics and hair extensions from her home for almost twelve years; this allows her to meet the family's needs without too much difficulty. In order to better meet her customer's needs, Sylvie Megnissè wants to strengthen her business. To do this, she is requesting a second loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the ENAGNON group. The previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Nidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es casada y con 3 hijos los cuales son independientes, ella cuenta con un negocio de tortillerías  el cual tiene establecido  en su casa de habitación desde hace 8 años.

 El negocio lo inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que se vio en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y considero que la venta de tortillas le sería rentable y sus ingresos mejorarían para ella y sus hijos.

Doña Nidia es luchadora y con espíritu de superación, toda su vida le ha gustado trabajar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y quien además cuenta desde hace un año con una venta de granos y productos varios (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, enlatados, meneítos, galletas) y considera que en un futuro se quedara únicamente con la venta de granos. Además esta muy agradecida con Ceprodel que le ha brindado durante todo este tiempo que le ha financiado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia is married and has three independent children.  She has a tortilla-making business which has been established in a room of her house for eight years.

The business was started with her own efforts, since she needed to help with the expenses of the home and she thought that the sale of tortillas would be profitable and her income would improve to help her and her children.

Nidia is a fighter and she has the spirit to excel. Her whole life she has enjoyed working to improve her life conditions and she has also been selling, for a year, grains and miscellaneous other products [rice, beans, sugar, canned meneítos (puffed corn-based snacks), and cookies]. 

She believes that in the future she will only stick with the sale of grains. 

She is also very thankful to Ceprodel for what they have offered her during all this time, and for financing her investments in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, firewood, lime, rice, and oil

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 28 years old. He has three children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, cassava, bananas, groundnuts and sweet potatoes. They also have cows, goats, sheep and chickens. 

Ben looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Ben will grow his farming business. He dreams of owning one of the most productive dairy farms in his area.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a food business. Elsie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF, and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 45-year-old married mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business for several years now. This is the source of her income.
Ma. Luisa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other fishing materials.
With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Kayatu

texts.en:
Kayatu is 26. She lives together with her friend at West Point, and has completed high school education. She has two
children between the ages of 3 and 5. Only one of the children lives with her at home and is attending school, while the other child stay with an aunt. Her friend works as a mechanic. Kayatu has been involved in used clothing sales, for the past five years. She sells used cloth like bed sheets and curtains. She started this business with the little amount of 8000 LD. She makes profits when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods for the business. She has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Eliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old. He is married and has five children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow beans, bananas and coffee. They keep goats and pigs. They also have a small veterinary drug shop.

Charles looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village.  The information he provides will help them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Charles will invest in his animal pharmaceutical shop. He dreams of having a family with well-educated children that serves as a role-model family for the rest of his community.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale, which will enable him to provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is 26 years old, married, and has two children. One of the children is in school. 

Joven is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Joven requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, to purchase more clothing to sell to customers. She has been in this business for three years. 

Joven would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is asking for a new loan to make home improvements. He wants to buy building materials to construct a residential house. He will buy iron sheets, nails, timbers, and other materials. 

Thanks for the previous loan, which helped him pay school fees for his child who had been sent home. Katana says that his son is currently in school and he is doing well with his studies. 

Katana hopes to expand his retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to build a residential house.

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en: Emeline is 42 years old and married with 9 children. She would like to start a small business, Elei (design). In order to do this, Emeline needs a loan to purchase painting tools and designs to start her business. She hopes to use her profits to save for her kids' education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy paint, painting brushes, materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 7 years. He describes himself as humble and independent.  He operates a carpentry workshop where he sells furniture such as chairs, tables, stools,  and wall units. His business is located within a busy environment  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to purchase a water tank which will be used by his six family members. His business goal is to run a bigger carpentry workshop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business. John has previously taken three loans which he managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is a widow with five children, all of whom go to school. She sells clothes, especially underwear for ladies, and has been in the business for 15 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lucia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 24,000 loan from NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ehbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Ehbayar is 50 years old and lives with her mother and two children in a small house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her children, Batbayar and Zolboo, age 22 and 17 are medical university students. Her mother is sick and requires constant care. She has been operating various types of businesses since 1994. She has been renting a small cafeteria for years and because of her mother's medical condition, she is starting an organic food retailing store near her home. She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase organic food inventory for her grocery store business. She is a neat and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase organic food for her grocery store business

loans.name: Kpannah

texts.en:
Kpannah is 48 years old and lives in Kakata town. She is married and her husband has a pension. They have four children between the ages of  17 to 30 years. Only two of her children live with her. 

For the past ten years she has been selling charcoal, and dried goods. Sometimes she makes less profit because she as to buy at a higher price. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal, pepper, oil, vita, salt and okra. In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  charcoal, pepper, oil, vita, salt and okra.

loans.name: Hayati

texts.en:
Hayati is a 28-year-old single man, who is operating the family's butcher shop.  The shop has been in the family a long time and is well known and has many loyal customers.  It has been a profitable business and the only source of income for them, but it also needs more support to cover some of the operational costs.  Hayati is requesting a 3000 USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a quantity of beef for sale and also installing new door to the butcher shop. This will meet the customer’s needs and increase sales, which will increase the family's income positively.
Hayati is photographed inside the butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy beef  and install new door to the butcher shop.

loans.name: Dianita

texts.en:
Dianita is 69 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
Dianita has a general store in the Philippines. Dianita requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like bread, sugar, sardines and other groceries.
Dianita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Dianita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like bread, sugar, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Glenda Isabel

texts.es:
Glenda Isabel tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría.

Glenda Isabel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir creciendo con los cultivos.   

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Mocache. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es tener casa propia.  En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los hijos.
texts.en:
Glenda Isabel is 26 years old and involved in a civil union and has three children.  She lives with her spouse and children in the city of Ventanas in the provicne of Los Ríos

She is a member of the VRC AVANZA, and their members are all involved in farming and live in the area of Recinto Agua Frías.  They practically all grew up in the area and mostly they work in the fields of agricultural labor and livestock raising.

Glenda Isabel works in farming and grows corm, and in addition, she raises hens and pigs.  She is asking for this loan to buy agricultural inputs like urea, liquid weed killers, and fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to continue expanding her farming.

She will make her purchases in the city of Mocache.  Her challenges are the infestations and bad weather, and her dream is to have a house of her own.  In her free time, she likes taking care of her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like urea, liquid weed killers, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Idilfonso Aquilino

texts.es: Ildifonso de 56 anos de edad, soltero con 4 hijos mayores de edad, originario del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del  país. Él tiene por actividad económica una pulpería la cuál consisten en vender productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobrecitos de café, sobres de shapoo, bolsitas de salsa de tomate, arroz, cuajada, leche, jugos, pan, frijoles, huevos. Tiene 12 anos de tener el negocio y esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. EL negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un trabajo con menor esfuerzo ya que era recomendación del medico por problemas de salud. Decidió poner el negocio de pulpería en su casa. Y en la actualidad ha sido su medio de vida y ha crecido poco a poco. Él ya ha trabajado con fundación el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Ildifonso agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ildifonso is 56 years old with 4 grown children, and comes from the department of Chinandega, a place located in the western region of the country.  HIs primary business activity is a grocery business where he sells products for daily consumption in small quantities, such as coffee packets, shampoo packets, tomato sauce, rice, cheese curds, milk, juices, bread, beans, and eggs.  He has been working in the business for 12 years and it is located inside of his house.

He began this business because he needed a less physically demanding line of work, since that was the recommendation of his doctor to solve his health problems.  He decided to start a grocery store in his home.  Currently, this has been his way of making a living, and his business has grown little by little.  He has previously worked with Fundación León 2000, where he has demonstrated his responsibility in making timely payments.  He needs this loan to invest in working capital and stock his grocery in order to satisfy his customers' needs.

Ildifonso is thankful for the help that the investors at Kiva have offered to people who come from having few economic resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have sources of work with dignity.

loans.use: to stock his grocery with daily necessities.

loans.name: Mayllen Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mayllen” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; amasandería, venta de empanadas y sopaipillas, venta de ropa, lencería, feriantes, venta de papales de regalo, venta de relojes y pulseras, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Conchalí, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercero lugar, de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color azul oscuro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa semicorto, y lleva puesto unos lentes de sol en su cabeza.
Ella se dedica al rubro de amasandería, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que trabaja en un local que arrienda frente de su casa, prepara pan amasado, empanadas y sopaipillas, entrega a domicilio y los días de más venta son los fines de semana.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra la mayoría de los insumos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará huevos, pasas, aceite, gas, harina, mantequilla, sal, servilletas.
Una de las metas de Maria es seguir con el rubro y crecer cada dia mas, aumentando las ventas y agregando otros productos alimenticios para su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a sus tres hijos de 21, 14 y 9 años de edad, y una nieta de 1 año de edad.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
This communal bank, Mayllen, is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who make a living in various sectors, including a bakery, meat pie and "sopaipilla" [fried pastry] sales, clothing sales, lingerie, market merchants, wrapping paper sales, watch and bracelet sales, services, and other activities.  All of them are from the community of Conchalí, located in the city of Santiago. 

María is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she's standing in the first row, the third from the left, wearing a dark blue t-shirt.  Her dark-brown hair is on the short side, and she's wearing sunglasses on her head.

María has made a living for four years with a bakery.  She says she works in a space she rents across from her house.  She makes bread, meat pies, and sopaipillas.  She makes home deliveries and her busiest sales days are the weekends.  She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in various supermarkets and distributors, where she gets most of her supplies at a low cost, so it's economically fair.

With the loan she'll buy eggs, raisins, oil, gas, flour, butter, salt, and napkins.

One of María's goals is to continue in the field and grow more every day, increasing her sales and adding other food products for her customers.  This way she'll have a better quality of life.  María lives with her three children, ages 21, 14, and 9, and a granddaughter, age 1.

She's very grateful for and happy about the opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it opened the door to a job.  It also will allow her to invest in her business and her personal development, because she has learned to better organize her income and investments.  With regard to the communal bank group of which she's a member, she says there's very good communication.

Conchalí is a community in the northern part of the Santiago Metropolitan Region (location of Santiago, the capital of Chile).  It has a defined industrial area and many smaller-scale economic and commercial activities, including street markets, craft workshops, garages, bus terminals, and others. The microenterprise sector is very relevant to the commercial activity of the community.

loans.use: to buy eggs, raisins, oil, gas, flour, butter, salt, and napkins

loans.name: Zoila Ines

texts.es:
Zoila de 44 años de edad vive en el municipio de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 17 años. Allí tiene una pequeña fabrica de bolsos tejidos y artesanías en totumo y en material de madera country. La artesanía es un oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeña, porque proviene de familia de artesanos que trabajan tallando el totumo (fruto de este arbusto)  para comercializarlo, sus principales productos son accesorios para damas, mochilas tejidas y también agregó otro negocio que es la elaboración y venta de hayacas, un amasijo de harina o arroz con carnes y verduras envueltos en hojas de la planta de bijao. 
Sus ventas las realiza directamente a los clientes, que son vecinos y referidos, las cuales generan ingresos que apoyan el bienestar de su familia. Su meta más adelante es tener un taller donde formar las nuevas generaciones de artesanos, que algún día exportarán al mundo muchos de estos productos, con la calidad exigible del mercado globalizado.En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hilos, lana, tela de hamacas, pinturas para fabricar artesanías sobre pedidos y también necesita comprar insumos para vender pasteles y hayacas navideñas, como harina, arroz, aceite sal, verduras y cárnicos. Su credikiva, prevee ser una buena inversión multiplicable, porque la hará en una de las temporadas mas comerciales del año, donde todo lo que los comerciantes y productores ofrecen, encuentran salida rápida  en el mercado  en un momento de mucha rotación de dinero.
texts.en:
Zoila, 44 years old, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her partner and her two children, aged 13 and 17. There she has a small workshop for woven bags and handcrafts made from totumo wood and country-style wood. She learned handcrafting from the time she was very young, because she comes from a family of artisans who work sculpting totumo wood (the fruit of this bush) to sell. Her main products are women's accessories and woven backpacks. She also added another business, which is the production and sale of hayacas, flour or rice dough with meat and vegetables wrapped in leaves from the bijao plant.

She sells directly to her customers, who are neighbors and referrals. They generate income that supports her family's well-being. Her goal for the future is to have a workshop to shape the next generation of artisans that will one day export many of these products to the world with the quality necessary for the globalized market. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through it, she will buy thread, wool, hammock fabric, and paints to make handcrafts to order. She also needs to buy supplies to sell Christmas cakes and hayacas such as flour, rice, oil, salt, vegetables, and meat products. She anticipates that her Kiva loan will be a good multipliable investment, because she will do it during one of the most commercial seasons of the year, where everything merchants and producers offer goes quickly in the market at a time when a lot of money changes hands.

loans.use: to purchase thread, wool, hammock fabric, and paints to make handcrafts to order

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
José, administra una tienda, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad, esta actividad de la tienda su horario es de 6:00 am hasta 4:00pm, ofreciendo productos de primera necesidad.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como jabón, detergentes, frijoles, arroz, jugos,gaseosas, y más que le ayudaran a tener más surtido el negocio y mejorar sus ventas. 
La aspiración de José es poder a futuro mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, con el trabajo que realiza en el negocio.
texts.en:
José runs a store selling basic necessities between the hours of 6 am and 4 pm. He lives with his wife and two children aged 4 and 8.

He is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as soap, detergent, beans, rice, juice, and soft drinks which will help him to better stock his store and increase sales.

José's hope for the future is to improve his family's standard of living through his work at his store.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as soap, detergent, beans, rice, juice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ruvidia Yasmin

texts.es:
Ruvidia, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en casa de una abuela, ella tiene este negocio desde hace seis meses, lo heredo de su abuela, vende productos como arroz, frijoles maíz.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, este crédito le ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de efectivo para la compra de productos para la tienda.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos estudien, ella poder ayudarles con los ingresos de la tienda.
texts.en:
Ruvidia runs a store selling basic necessities such as rice, beans, corn etc. She lives with her husband and two children in her grandmother's house. She's had the business for seven months and inherited it from her grandmother. 

She is seeking a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil for the store. The loan will enable her to have more money available to buy stock.

Ruvidia's hope is that her children will be good students and that she will be able to help them with income from the store.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beans and oil

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура 29 года, проживает в гражданском браке. Мать 2 детей. Айнура в качестве основного дохода с 2009 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 7,500 KGS. Основным видом деятельности является продажа молока и перепродажи скота.По характеру Айнура человек очень доброжелательный и отзывчивый, она тот человек, который не откажет никому и не в чем. Благодаря упорному труду и старательности Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и 5 голов овец, на своей земле она сажает сахарную свеклу, ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом. В Бизнесе Айнура активно помогает муж. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  1 дойную корову. Корова позволит увеличить продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.  Целью в жизни Айнуры, дать высшее образование детям.
texts.en: Ainura is 29 years old, lives in a civil union and a mother of two children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2009, having started this business with 7,000 KGS.  The main business focus is selling milk and reselling livestock.  Ainura is a kind and responsive person.  She is the type of person, who will not refuse anything to anyone.
